0.title: Raj Kundra approached for 'Bigg Boss 16': Reports
0.article_body: Businessman Raj Kundra, husband of actress Shilpa Shetty Kundra, has been approached for 'Bigg Boss 16', as per reports. "They feel the real side and the truth needs to be shown in front of the country," a source was quoted as saying. Raj was arrested in a pornography case in July 2021 and was released in September.

1.title: Arshdeep dropping such an easy catch was a bit surprising: Rajkumar
1.article_body: Reacting to India pacer Arshdeep Singh dropping a catch against Pakistan during their Super 4 stage match at Asia Cup 2022, Virat Kohli's childhood coach Rajkumar Sharma said it was surprising to see such an easy catch dropped. Arshdeep put down a sitter while Asif Ali was batting at zero in 18th over of Pakistan's innings. Ali scored 16 (8).

2.title: Anurag Thakur calls AAP government 'bewdi sarkar'
2.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur criticised AAP government and called it a "bewdi sarkar". He alleged that Delhi CM and his deputy were involved in the liquor scam with mafia. "They are encouraging the liquor mafia. AAP doesn’t have an answer to it. It is a corrupt government. This is the identity of Arvind Kejriwal-led bewdi sarkar," said Thakur.

3.title: Novaya Gazeta newspaper's media license revoked by Russian court
3.article_body: A Russian court revoked the media license of Novaya Gazeta newspaper on Monday. Russia's media watchdog Rozkomnadzor had moved court in July accusing Novaya Gazeta of not providing documents related to a change of ownership in 2006 and sought cancellation of its license. Notably, the newspaper ceased operations when Russia tightened rules for covering the conflict in Ukraine.

4.title: BJP's 'sting' video is a 'joke', I have stings as well: Delhi Dy CM Sisodia
4.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Monday questioned the veracity of BJP's 'sting video' regarding his involvement in the excise policy scam and called it a joke, adding that he has such videos as well. The video reveals that 80% of the profit will go to Arvind Kejriwal, Manish Sisodia and their friend, said BJP's Sambit Patra.

5.title: Liz Truss named as UK's next Prime Minister
5.article_body: Liz Truss has been named as the leader of the Conservative Party and UK's new Prime Minister after defeating Rishi Sunak, the former finance minister. UK caretaker PM Boris Johnson will travel to Scotland to meet Queen Elizabeth on Tuesday and officially tender his resignation. Former foreign minister Truss promised to act quickly to tackle UK's cost of living crisis.

6.title: Some faulty project reports responsible for road accidents: Gadkari
6.article_body: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari on Monday attributed some of the road accidents to few faulty project reports. "Some DPRs (Detailed Project Reports) prepared by companies are worst and are responsible for road accidents," Gadkari said. Furthermore, he said, "Beginning should be made from DPR. If the companies preparing DPRs do not improve, the problem will reoccur."

7.title: Ghaziabad Police arrests gang of drug smugglers with heroin worth ₹1 cr
7.article_body: Ghaziabad Police have arrested five people, including a woman, for allegedly smuggling heroin worth approximately ₹1 crore from Jharkhand to other states, officials said Sunday. The accused often changed cars, switched off their phones and would cut off all communication until the drugs were delivered to the buyer at a given location and time, reports said.

8.title: I'd love to be Hrithik's bouncer for a day: 'Babli Bouncer' actress Tamannaah
8.article_body: Actress Tamannaah Bhatia called Hrithik Roshan and Vicky Kaushal her favourites during the trailer launch of her upcoming movie 'Babli Bouncer'. "I would love to be Hrithik's bouncer for a day. I would also love to be Vicky's bouncer," she added. The film, directed by Madhur Bhandarkar, will feature Tamannaah as a female bouncer.

9.title: The way Bishnoi handled power play, dismissed Babar was fantastic: Irfan
9.article_body: Former India cricketer Irfan Pathan has said the way India's 22-year-old spinner Ravi Bishnoi handled the power play and picked Pakistan captain Babar Azam's wicket in the fourth over was "fantastic". Irfan added, "It is not easy, the pressure on the Indian bowlers during the game against Pakistan is a lot and Bishnoi handled the pressure very well."

10.title: Police constable suspended over video of him fighting with home guard in UP
10.article_body: A police constable was suspended after a video showing him fighting with a home guard in Uttar Pradesh's Jalaun surfaced on social media. The video, shot by a passerby, shows the two fighting at a roadside while a third official tried to stop them. "The home guard has been sent back...Strict action will be taken," said Jalaun SP Ravi Kumar.

11.title: SpiceJet defaults on depositing PF amount to staff's accounts: Report
11.article_body: SpiceJet, which delayed the disbursal of salaries amongst employees for the second consecutive month, has reportedly not deposited PF amounts in staff’s accounts. The airline has also allegedly defaulted on depositing TDS with authorities. Meanwhile, a spokesperson said that while there has been a deferral on discharging of payments, there has been no default on any statutory payments.

12.title: Will provide LPG cylinder at ₹500: Rahul in poll-bound Gujarat
12.article_body: Ahead of the Gujarat polls, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi promised a loan waiver of up to ₹3 lakh to farmers and LPG cylinders at ₹500 instead of the current price of ₹1,000 if the party comes to power in the state. He also announced free electricity to farmers and up to 300 units of free power to general consumers.

13.title: Guj is one state where you've to take permission before protesting: Rahul
13.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Monday said that Gujarat has become the "centre of drugs". "All drugs are moved from Mundra port...government doesn't take any action...This is the Gujarat model," he said in Ahmedabad. "Gujarat is one state where you have to take permission before protesting, permission from those against whom protest will be done," he stated.

14.title: Kerala church stops use of coffins, opts for nature-friendly burials
14.article_body: In a break from tradition, a Catholic church has decided to stop using caskets to bury the dead. The body will instead be wrapped in a plain linen cloth and lowered into the tomb. Parish priest Father Johnson Thaundiyil said that it will speed up decomposition. "We are returning to the simple, nature-friendly burial practice," he said.

15.title: BMC to install portable clinics in Mumbai slums amid surge in viral infections
15.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has decided to set up 15 porta cabin clinics and 13 polyclinics in Mumbai's slum areas which will be operational by the end of this month. The move comes after Mumbai recorded a spike in viral infections and vector-borne diseases. The clinics will operate in two shifts from 7 am to 10 pm.

16.title: Rainfall activity likely to increase in Pune from September 8: IMD
16.article_body: The rainfall activity is likely to increase in Pune city from September 8, according to India Meteorological Department (IMD). Officials from the weather department said there'll be continuous rainfall from September 11 to September 13 and the last day of Ganpati Visarjan is likely to witness more rainfall. Reportedly, the Pune district reported 31% excess rainfall during the monsoon season.

17.title: Guys like Pant, Hooda need to learn the way Kohli runs between wickets: Gambhir
17.article_body: Ex-India opener Gautam Gambhir has said all youngsters in Team India need to learn the way Virat Kohli runs between the wickets. "Suryakumar might have more shots...but Virat is never under pressure because of the way he runs, the way he converts ones into twos," explained Gambhir. "Not every time you'll be able to hit those big shots," he added.

18.title: 24-yr-old rape survivor fails 'virginity' test in Raj, forced to pay ₹10 lakh
18.article_body: A 24-year-old bride was allegedly tortured, beaten and forced to undergo a chastity (virginity) test in Rajasthan's Bhilwara district. A penalty of ₹10 lakh was also imposed on the rape survivor's family by the khap panchayat after she failed the test. Her father-in-law, despite knowing about the incident, made her go through the humiliation, a police official said.

19.title: Police constable in Pune injured after being attacked by criminal
19.article_body: A police constable in Pune was injured after Akash alias Bhavdya Bharat Kudale, a criminal, attacked a team of police officers from Pimpri-Chinchwad which was there to arrest him. Officials said that the injured police constable, identified as Amol Gulab Mane, is currently undergoing medical treatment in a private hospital. Mane was attacked when he was questioning the accused.

20.title: Parts of Somalia to face famine in October and December: UN
20.article_body: The United Nations has issued a warning that parts of Somalia will face a famine between October and December amid rising global food prices and worsening drought. According to experts, the Horn of Africa might face a failed rainy season for a fifth consecutive time. In 2011, Somalia faced more than quarter of a million deaths due to a famine.

21.title: It was a costly miss but it happens: Jaffer on Arshdeep dropping Asif's catch
21.article_body: Former India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said that Arshdeep Singh's catch drop can't be blamed for India's defeat against Pakistan in their Asia Cup Super 4 stage match. "There's no doubt that it was a costly miss...but it happens in cricket at times...you can't just blame a [dropped] catch," he stated. Arshdeep dropped Asif Ali's catch in the 18th over.

22.title: 150 mobile tanks for Ganpati immersion deployed across Pune
22.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) deployed 150 mobile tanks for Ganpati immersion across the city on Sunday. Dr Ketaki Ghadge, Assistant Health Officer, PMC's solid waste management department, said, "Apart from that, 303 permanent tanks are also constructed in various parts of the city, and 216 idol donation spots [were] set up." Some residents also immersed the idols in rivers.

23.title: Around 10,000 sanitation workers to work for Ganesh immersion in Hyderabad
23.article_body: Around 10,000 sanitation workers, 280 cranes along with 100 swimmers with boats will be employed at all the water bodies in Hyderabad on September 9 for Ganesh idol immersion, GHMC Mayor Gadwal Vijayalaxmi said. As per the Mayor's directions, at every 3 to 4 kilometres there should be 25 sanitation employees, and around 14 volunteers to operate cranes.

24.title: Manmohan Singh selected me as professor at IIT Delhi in 1970: Swamy
24.article_body: BJP member Subramanian Swamy recalled his first meeting with former PM Manmohan Singh. "[In] 1970, I was selected by Manmohan as an Economics Professor at IIT Delhi. He chaired the 10-member selection committee and unanimously got me chosen against all Communists screaming away," Swamy tweeted. He added, "In 1990...I got him selected as [an] Economic Adviser to ex-PM Chandra Shekhar."

25.title: 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' is no 'Mann Ki Baat', it's about concern for people: Cong
25.article_body: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh on Monday said 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' is not a 'Mann Ki Baat' in any manner. "It's about the concern for people. Its objective is to ensure that the concerns and demands expressed by the people reach Delhi," Ramesh added. "It (yatra) is not about long speeches, preaching, dramatics [or] teleprompter, we're going to listen," he stated.

26.title: Boy steals women's undergarments in Gwalior; caught on CCTV camera
26.article_body: A ladies' undergarments thief is running amok in Madhya Pradesh's Gwalior, a report said. Police have registered a case after a businessman reported that a boy entered his house in the middle of the night and stole his wife's undergarments. He was also caught on CCTV camera. Meanwhile, police have identified the accused as a local living in the area.

27.title: Govt committed to privatisation, bank reforms amid challenges: FM
27.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said India is the fastest growing economy despite global headwinds. During her address at an event, Sitharaman said the government is committed to privatising PSU enterprises. She emphasised that India will have to reset a lot of things to be a developed nation by 2047, calling digitisation, education and infrastructure the biggest tools.

28.title: I don't think any film can tank because of boycott trend: Goldie on 'Liger'
28.article_body: Filmmaker Goldie Behl, when asked if Vijay Deverakonda's 'Liger' failed because of the boycott trend, said, "No, I don't think so any film can tank at...box office because of a trend of boycotting...film." He added no trend can stop a good film from succeeding. He further said if a film connects with the audience, nothing can stop it from succeeding.

29.title: At times I feel bad: Bhavana on actors making fun of Chunky Panday
29.article_body: Bhavana Pandey, wife of actor Chunky Panday, said on 'Fabulous Lives of Bollywood Wives' that she sometimes feels bad when her husband's co-actors make fun of him. "Sometimes I'm like, 'Why do you allow them?'," she added. Chunky, however, said that he feels he should always be the topic of discussion whether good or bad.

30.title: KRK seems to be victim of conspiracy: Shatrughan Sinha on his arrest
30.article_body: Actor-turned-politician Shatrughan Sinha has defended Kamaal R Khan after the latter was arrested by Malad Police last week over the tweets he posted in 2020. "He seems to be a victim of a conspiracy of circumstances...wish...that KRK gets justice which he deserves soon," Shatrughan tweeted. KRK was arrested again on Monday for demanding sexual favours in a 2019 case.

31.title: BJP releases 'sting video' to claim AAP leaders took money under excise policy
31.article_body: BJP has released 'sting videos' to claim Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal and deputy CM Manish Sisodia took "commissions" worth "hundreds of crores" to benefit private players under the now scrapped excise policy. BJP said, "Why was the older policy, and then new one, withdrawn; why were blacklisted companies given contracts and why was the commission increased from 2% to 12%?"

32.title: Uddhav ditched BJP by breaking alliance in 2014 for seeking 2 seats: Shah
32.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Monday said Shiv Sena President Uddhav Thackeray ditched BJP by breaking their alliance in 2014 for seeking two seats. "Uddhav Thackeray betrayed BJP after seeking votes on the names of (Prime Minister) Narendra Modi and (Maharashtra Deputy CM) Devendra Fadnavis," Shah said. "Those who ditch somebody in politics never become successful," he added.

33.title: J'khand govt obstructing probe into 2 minor girls' deaths: NCPCR chief
33.article_body: NCPCR chief Priyank Kanoongo, who reached Jharkhand's Dumka to probe deaths of two minor girls, said the state government is "very uncooperative" and is "obstructing the investigation". "A team of NCPCR wanted to meet the family of the girl who was hanged after rape…After coming to the village, however, her parents could not be found," tweeted Kanoongo.

34.title: CBI officer died by suicide as he was pressured to frame me in fake case: Manish Sisodia
34.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia claimed a CBI officer died by suicide as he was pressured to frame him in a "fake case". "He wasn't permitting it...Pressure was being mounted to make a false case legally sound," Sisodia added. Sisodia's remarks come after BJP claimed he took "commissions" worth "crores" to benefit private players under the now scrapped excise policy.

35.title: RERA warns of action against agents charging arbitrary brokerage in G'gram
35.article_body: The Haryana Real Estate Regulatory Authority (HRERA) warned real estate agents of action against charging arbitrary brokerage from property buyers and sellers. The authority issued a warning to 1,840 agents in Gurugram. "We will revoke, blacklist and debar agents or brokers who charge exorbitant commissions in contravention of the rule," HRERA Gurugram Chairman KK Khandelwal said.

36.title: Former Malaysian PM Najib jailed for corruption seeks royal pardon
36.article_body: Former Malaysian PM Najib Razak, who was sentenced to 12 years of imprisonment for corruption, has applied for a royal pardon, the country's Parliament Speaker said on Monday. In August, Malaysia's top court upheld Najib's conviction in state fund 1Malaysia Development Berhad corruption case. Najib will lose his parliamentary seat only if the petition is rejected, the Parliament Speaker added.

37.title: BJP leader Kirpal Singh shot dead in Rajasthan, police suspect gang rivalry
37.article_body: BJP leader Kirpal Singh, a close aide of BJP MP from Rajasthan's Bharatpur Ranjeeta Koli, was shot dead in the city on Sunday. The assailants opened fire at Kirpal while he was going home from circuit house in his car. Police suspect the killing to be a result of gang rivalry. "The accused are being identified," a police official said.

38.title: I feel guilty I'm unable to spend time with newborn son: Dheeraj Dhoopar
38.article_body: Actor Dheeraj Dhooper has said he feels guilty as he is unable to spend "enough time" with his newborn son. Speaking about his busy schedule, Dheeraj said he wished he had 50 hours in a day. "The 24 hours I have, I'm just going all out...doing everything that's needed," he added. The actor is part of 'Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa 10'.

39.title: Had Nawaz not scored, Pak wouldn’t have reached till the end: Sehwag
39.article_body: Former India opener Virender Sehwag has said all-rounder Muhammad Nawaz played the most impactful innings among the Pakistan batters while chasing India's 182-run target. "Had Nawaz not scored 40 off 22 deliveries, Pakistan would not have reached till the end...helped take the pressure off Rizwan," stated Sehwag. Nawaz and Rizwan added 73 runs off 41 balls.

40.title: Researchers working on app to detect COVID-19 using users' voice samples
40.article_body: Researchers at Netherland's Maastricht University on Monday said they're working on a smartphone app that can accurately detect COVID-19 infection in people's voices with the help of artificial intelligence. They claimed that the app is more accurate than several antigen tests. The app's results have a turnaround time of less than a minute, a researcher said.

41.title: Video shows policeman clearing waterlogged B'luru street with stick
41.article_body: The Bengaluru Traffic Police on Monday shared a video showing a policeman clearing the waterlogged Spice Garden. Several parts of the city were severely waterlogged and traffic was affected due to heavy rains. Bengaluru recorded 131.6 mm of rainfall in the last 24 hours, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) said.

42.title: Centre abolishes 3,000 CISF posts at airports, Congress criticises move
42.article_body: The Centre has decided to abolish 3,049 CISF aviation security posts, which will be replaced by 1,924 private security personnel at various airports. The Congress criticised the move saying the government is playing with the security of the airports. "Actions in the name of cutting down on security expenses cannot be tolerated," said the party.

43.title: BJP trying to create civil war-like situation in country: Soren
43.article_body: Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren on Monday said that the BJP is trying to create a "civil war-like situation in the country by fuelling riots to win elections". Soren made the statement during a state Assembly session convened to hold trust motion. "The BJP has been indulging in horse-trading of legislators," he added.

44.title: Sanjay Raut’s custody extended till September 19 in land scam case
44.article_body: A special PMLA court extended Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut’s judicial custody till September 19. He was arrested by the ED on August 1 after over six hours of questioning in the ₹1,034-crore Patra Chawl land scam case. Earlier in August, Raut’s wife was also questioned by the probe agency in connection to the same case.

45.title: 6 booked for torturing, assaulting doctor over dowry in Gurugram
45.article_body: Gurugram Police have registered an FIR against a man and his five family members, for allegedly subjecting his wife, a doctor of the Haryana government, to cruelty and mental and physical torture for dowry. Police said that the doctor had also alleged that she was subjected to unnatural sex by her husband.

46.title: 19-year-old man arrested for raping class 8 student in Gurugram
46.article_body: A 19-year-old man was arrested by the Gurugram Police for allegedly raping a class 8 student. The accused, Shiva, allegedly laced a drink with some sedatives and then raped the 14-year-old girl at an isolated place, police said. Notably, Shiva works with a Manesar-based private company and has been currently sent to 14-day judicial custody, police added.

47.title: Appears to be handiwork of another IT cell: Panag on Arshdeep being trolled
47.article_body: Actress Gul Panag defended pacer Arshdeep Singh on Twitter after the latter was trolled for dropping a catch during India versus Pakistan Asia Cup 2022 Super 4 stage match. "Truly tragic the way Arshdeep has been trolled...it appears to be the handiwork of another IT cell," Panag tweeted. Arshdeep had dropped Asif Ali's catch in the 18th over.

48.title: SC notice to ECI over plea against political parties using religion symbols
48.article_body: Supreme Court on Monday issued a notice to the Election Commission of India (ECI) following a plea to cancel symbols and names allotted to political parties which use religion or religious connotations. The plea states using religion to lure voters is strictly prohibited under section 123 of The Representation of People Act, 1951 citing the secular values of the Constitution.

49.title: Gurugram district reports 1st death related to lumpy skin disease
49.article_body: Gurugram district on Friday reported its first death related to the lumpy skin disease. The Deputy Director of Haryana's Animal Husbandry and Dairying Department, Dr Punita Gahlawat said that a one-year-old Heifer cow has died in Pataudi's Noorgarh village. As per the department, 94 cases of the disease have been detected in 24 areas in the district.

50.title: BJP attempting to destabilise democratically elected state govts: J'khand CM
50.article_body: BJP is attempting to destabilise democratically elected state governments in non-BJP ruled states, Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren said on Monday in state Assembly. "Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma indulged in purchase of Jharkhand MLAs," Soren added during the confidence motion. "They want to create an atmosphere of civil war and want to fan riots to win polls," he stated.

51.title: Bengaluru sees wettest September day since 2014
51.article_body: Bengaluru on Monday saw the wettest September day since 2014, with a rainfall of 131.6 mm in the last 24 hours. Several parts of the city were heavily waterlogged and traffic was affected due to the downpour. Traffic police asked people to avoid Outer Ring Road, Sarjapura Road, Doddakannelli Road and Bellandur Road.

52.title: 8 killed as 5.3 magnitude earthquake hits Afghanistan
52.article_body: At least eight people were killed after an earthquake hit northeastern Afghanistan on Monday, the state news agency reported. According to the United States Geological Survey (USGS), the 5.3 magnitude earthquake struck near the city of Jalalabad. Afghanistan was hit by a strong earthquake in June in which more than 1,000 people were killed.

53.title: Israeli Prez visits Germany to commemorate Munich Olympics massacre
53.article_body: Israeli President Isaac Herzog has arrived in Germany for a three-day visit. He will join a commemoration ceremony for the 50th anniversary of the massacre at the 1972 Munich Olympics. Relatives of the victims, who had initially declined, will attend the commemoration. On Tuesday, Herzog will give a speech in the German Parliament and will visit a former concentration camp.

54.title: Thieves drill hole in TN shop's wall, pass out after drinking liquor they came to steal
54.article_body: Two men were arrested in Tamil Nadu after they allegedly drilled a hole in the wall of a liquor shop and ended up passing out in the shop after drinking the same liquor they had come to steal. The police also recorded a video of how they came out of the same hole they had drilled for the theft.

55.title: Kyrgios played like Nadal, Djokovic: Medvedev on US Open 4th round loss
55.article_body: After defending champion Daniil Medvedev crashed out of US Open 2022 following his loss against 23rd seed Nick Kyrgios, Medvedev said that the Australian played to the level of Rafael Nadal and Novak Djokovic in the fourth round. "It was a high-level match...He [Kyrgios] is tough to play," he added. Kyrgios defeated world number one Medvedev 7-6(13-11), 3-6, 6-3, 6-2.

56.title: Porsche IPO is a 'key element' of our strategy: Volkswagen CFO
56.article_body: Volkswagen CFO Arno Antlitz has said the planned listing of Porsche is a "key element" of the firm's strategy. Its management and supervisory boards are to discuss the possibility of an IPO at September end or early October amid troubled global markets. Antlitz added the possible IPO proceeds would give the firm more flexibility to further accelerate its transformation.

57.title: Hyderabad Madrassa teacher sent to judicial custody for sodomising minor
57.article_body: A Hyderabad Madrassa teacher has been sent to judicial custody after he was arrested for allegedly sodomising a 14-year-old minor in the Santosh Nagar area. "A case was filed under the relevant sections of POCSO after the victim’s family filed a complaint against the teacher...The accused was arrested and has been sent to judicial remand,” police said.

58.title: Differently-abled girl kills self in UP hostel, no suicide note recovered
58.article_body: A 26-year-old differently-abled female student allegedly died by suicide in her hostel room on the campus of Dr Shakuntala Misra National Rehabilitation University (DSMNRU) here in Lucknow. Reports said that she was rushed to the Lok Bandhu hospital, where she was declared dead. Police said no suicide note has been recovered.

59.title: Foreign policies no longer impacted by vote bank politics: Jaishankar
59.article_body: Talking about India-Israel ties, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said that those days are gone when vote bank politics impacted foreign policies. “We had some political reasons owing to which we did not further our ties with Israel. We restricted ourselves. PM Modi was the first PM in the history of India to have visited Israel,” said Jaishankar.

60.title: S Korea raises typhoon alert to 'very strong', many flights cancelled
60.article_body: South Korea has raised the typhoon alert as the south of the country witnessed heavy rains and strong winds. Typhoon Hinnamnor led to flight cancellation, school closure and suspension of business operations. Warnings have been issued in southern cities of Busan, Gwangju, Daegu, Ulsan and Jeju. Hinnamnor has been categorised as a "very strong" typhoon.

61.title: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar likely to meet opposition leaders in Delhi today
61.article_body: According to reports, Bihar CM Nitish Kumar is expected to meet prominent leaders in the national capital today to talk about strengthening opposition unity for the 2024 Lok Sabha elections. “If all (opposition) parties fight together, the BJP will be packed...We will work on that. BJP has disrupted the social and communal harmony,” Kumar said during JD(U)'s executive meet.

62.title: Improvement in per capita income would have been satisfactory: Mayawati
62.article_body: As India overtook the UK to become the world’s fifth largest economy, former UP CM Mayawati said that it would have been satisfactory if figures showed improvement in per capita income. “Britain's per capita income is about 20 times more than India…If India achieves it, it will help in removing country’s problems like poverty and unemployment," said Mayawati.

63.title: Home Minister Amit Shah meets Rohit Shetty in Mumbai, shares pic
63.article_body: Home Minister Amit Shah, who is on a two-day visit to Mumbai, met filmmaker Rohit Shetty. Taking to Twitter, Shah shared a picture from the meeting and wrote, "Met noted director Rohit Shetty, today in Mumbai." 'Singham' director Rohit's upcoming directorial 'Indian Police Force' features actor Sidharth Malhotra and actress Shilpa Shetty.

64.title: Rajinikanth, Haasan to attend pre-release event of 'Ponniyin...'
64.article_body: Actors Rajinikanth and Kamal Haasan will be attending the music and trailer launch event of Mani Ratnam's 'Ponniyin Selvan: Part One', Lyca Productions tweeted. "It can't get any bigger or better than this," the tweet further read. The event will take place on September 6. Vikram, Karthi and Aishwarya Rai Bachchan will feature in the film.

65.title: We were expecting short balls: Nawaz on scoring 42(20) vs India
65.article_body: Pakistan all-rounder Muhammad Nawaz has said they were prepared for India's short-ball attack in their Asia Cup match on Sunday. "In the first match they got wickets from short balls, so we were expecting them to go that route again. We practiced with this thought in mind," he added. Nawaz smashed 42(20) to help Pakistan chase down India's 181-run total.

66.title: WhatsApp may soon allow users to text themselves across devices: Report
66.article_body: WhatsApp is working on a feature to allow users to message themselves from multiple devices linked to their accounts, WABetaInfo reported. The feature was spotted in the desktop beta. Once the feature is available to users, they will see a contact labeled 'You' in their chat list and they will be able to send messages to it via linked devices.

67.title: S Korean govt's YouTube channel hacked, streams Elon Musk's interview: Report
67.article_body: The South Korean government's YouTube channel was hacked on Saturday to stream the video of an interview with Tesla CEO Elon Musk, according to reports. The channel's name was changed to 'SpaceX Invest' and it showed a live broadcast on cryptocurrency. A government official said security measures were undertaken and the channel was restored about four hours after the hack.

68.title: UP CM Yogi orders joint probe into fire incident at Lucknow hotel
68.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Monday ordered a joint probe by the Divisional Commissioner and Police Commissioner of Lucknow into the fire incident at Hotel Levana in Hazratganj area. Two people were killed in the fire that broke out on Monday morning. Relief teams had to break the windows of the hotel with iron rods to rescue trapped people.

69.title: 30-yr-old woman killed by tanker while avoiding pothole in Thane
69.article_body: A 30-year-old woman was crushed to death by a tanker after she fell off her two-wheeler while avoiding a pothole in Maharashtra's Thane district on Sunday, police said. The victim, identified as Kavita Mhatre, was riding her scooter to work when she tried to avoid a pothole on the flyover and fell, an official from the city police said.

70.title: Suicide bomber blows himself up outside Russian embassy in Kabul, several feared dead
70.article_body: A suicide bomber blew himself up outside the the Russian embassy in Afghanistan's Kabul. Several people are feared to be dead in the attack. The Russian Foreign Ministry confirmed that at least two embassy staffers have been killed. As per the police, the suicide bomber was shot dead by the guards, but he still succeeded in detonating the device.

71.title: NIA court rejects Gautam Navlakha's bail plea in Elgar Parishad case
71.article_body: A special NIA court on Monday rejected the bail plea of activist Gautam Navlakha, who was arrested in connection with the Elgar Parishad case. The case pertains to alleged inflammatory speeches made at the Pune event in 2017. After being placed under house arrest initially, he was later sent to judicial custody at Navi Mumbai's Taloja prison.

72.title: Hyd college staffer injured in student leader's suicide bid, dies
72.article_body: Hyderabad's Narayana college's administration officer succumbed to burn injuries after a student leader's suicide bid at the college started a fire. The incident took place in August and a few people, including the student and the deceased, were injured. The student leader had doused himself in petrol and threatened to set himself on fire over a student's transfer certificate's non-issuance.

73.title: Govt summons Wikipedia execs after Arshdeep's page edited to show links with Khalistan
73.article_body: The government has summoned Wikipedia executives after India pacer Arshdeep Singh's page was edited to show links with Khalistan after he dropped a catch against Pakistan. As per preliminary reports, the edits were made by accounts linked to Pakistan. The government panel will reportedly question Wikipedia executives on checks and balances in place on their platform to avoid such edits.

74.title: Extremely ordinary bowling performance, no idea what Chahal was doing: Sodhi
74.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Reetinder Sodhi has criticised Team India's bowling against Pakistan, stating that it was an "extremely ordinary performance". "I have no idea what Chahal was doing in the 15th over...Hardik was probably thinking that he was bowling in the last game where the wicket was spongy. Bhuvneshwar completely forgot to bowl the yorkers in the 19th over," added Sodhi.

75.title: Nitish Kumar meets Lalu Yadav in Patna before leaving for Delhi
75.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar met RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav at the latter's residence in Patna today before leaving for Delhi. Kumar met Yadav in the presence of Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav and Rabri Devi. Nitish Kumar will reportedly meet the leaders of Opposition parties including Congress leader Rahul Gandhi during his two days stay in Delhi.

76.title: 52% cases of crime against women in 2022 considered false in Raj: Data
76.article_body: As per police data till July 2022, only 48% of the total cases of crimes against women in Rajasthan included a final report (FR), while 52% of the total cases were considered false. The cases in which FR was imposed also include those in which victims didn't give statements over social pressure or lack of witnesses during police investigation.

77.title: Supreme Court issues notice to Centre to control population explosion
77.article_body: Supreme Court on Monday issued notice to Centre on a PIL seeking directions to frame effective rules, regulations and guidelines to control population explosion. The apex court has tagged the plea along with similar or pending PILs. The new PIL seeks to make Two-Child Law as criteria for government jobs, aids and subsidies and rights to vote, contest and property.

78.title: Don't humiliate anyone on these mistakes: Hafeez on Arshdeep getting abused for catch drop
78.article_body: Former Pakistan all-rounder Mohammad Hafeez took to Twitter to defend Team India fast bowler Arshdeep Singh after he was abused on social media for dropping a catch against Pakistan on Sunday. "My request to all Indian team fans. In sports we make mistakes as we [are] human. Please don’t humiliate anyone on these mistakes," he wrote.

79.title: Central Bank files ₹1,047 cr insolvency case against Future's Biyanis: Report
79.article_body: Central Bank of India has filed a personal insolvency case against debt-laden Future Group's promoters, The Economic Times reported. The bank is claiming a total of ₹1,047 crore from the company's Founder Kishore Biyani, his brother Vijay Biyani and cousin Sunil Biyani, the report said. Future Group is facing bankruptcy proceedings after its deal with Reliance Industries fell through.

80.title: Delhi initiates pilot project of Student Advisory Board in govt schools
80.article_body: Delhi Directorate of Education (DoE) has initiated a pilot project inducting school students into a Student Advisory Board (SAB) in the national capital's government schools. SAB will comprise students from classes 7, 8, 9 and 11 and they will be elected through intra-section elections. The parameters include over 90% attendance, timely submissions of work and participation in group activities.

81.title: India's school education among world's largest education systems: Prez
81.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu on Monday said India's school education is among the world's largest education systems. "Talent development in science, literature and social sciences can be more effective if taught in the mother tongue," she added while addressing the gathering at National Teachers Awards ceremony. She also recalled the contribution of her school teachers.

82.title: 3 men, including 'politician's son' strip, flash; assault man in Mumbai
82.article_body: A family, including a seven-year-old girl, were subjected to foul language and the child's father was manhandled when they objected to three men urinating and holding their private parts in Mumbai. One of the accused asked a constable who arrived on the scene to speak to his 'politician mother' and escaped, reports said. Another accused also escaped.

83.title: Bengaluru drinking water supply to be hit for 2 days as BWSSB pumping station submerged
83.article_body: Drinking water supply from the river Cauvery to Bengaluru will be affected for two days as the Bangalore Water Supply and Sewerage Board (BWSSB) pumping station in Karnataka's Mandya district is submerged due to heavy rains, reports said. Meanwhile, heavy rains have caused traffic disruptions in the city. Chaos was also witnessed at the Bengaluru airport.

84.title: 6.8 magnitude earthquake hits China, 7 die
84.article_body: At least seven people have died after an earthquake of magnitude 6.8 hit Luding county in China's Sichuan province on Monday, state media reported. Authorities have reported that the earthquake caused landslides, damaged houses and caused power disruptions, state broadcaster CCTV said. Moreover, the country's Ministry of Emergency Management said that one landslide has blocked a rural highway.

85.title: Ghaziabad man, wife argue over his affair, daughter kills him with stone
85.article_body: A 40-year-old jeweller was found dead in his car on Sunday in Ghaziabad. His wife and daughter have been arrested for his murder. The accused said that deceased man had an extramarital affair. The wife and the man got into an argument on the intervening night of Saturday and Sunday, during which, the daughter hit the man with a stone.

86.title: Crab shells to make biodegradable electrolyte for batteries in US
86.article_body: University of Maryland's Center for Materials Innovation scientists have developed a new zinc battery with an electrolyte extracted from crab shells. The electrolyte is made from chitosan, a chemical derivative of chitin found in crab shells. About two-thirds of the battery could be broken down by microbes. The battery reportedly has an energy efficiency of 99.7% after 1,000 battery cycles.

87.title: Barring a few, condition of govt schools across country is pathetic: Kejriwal
87.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that unless we start providing good education in government schools, the dream of becoming a developed country will always remain distant. "We know that the condition of government schools all across the country, barring a few, is pathetic," Kejriwal added while addressing an event in Chennai.

88.title: Cloudflare blocks hate site Kiwi Farms over ‘threat to human life’
88.article_body: Cloudflare has blocked harassment campaign site Kiwi Farms citing an escalation in targeted threats on it. Cloudflare came under pressure to drop Kiwi Farms as a customer after the forum forced a transgender Twitch streamer into hiding. "We believe there is an unprecedented emergency and immediate threat to human life unlike we have previously seen from Kiwi Farms," Cloudflare said.

89.title: Over 17,800 Ganesh idols immersed in Mumbai on day 5 of Ganeshotsav
89.article_body: Over 17,800 Ganesh idols were immersed at Mumbai's beaches and artificial ponds on the fifth day of Ganeshotsav (Sunday), a Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) official said. As many as 17,536 household idols, 23 Hartalika and 261 sarvajanik (community) idols were immersed till 9 pm yesterday, the official added. Out of these, over 6,900 idols were immersed in artificial ponds.

90.title: I miss Balwinder Singh Sandhu & his contribution to 83: Ranveer Singh
90.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh has said that he "really misses" former cricketer Balwinder Singh Sandhu and his contribution to his film '83'. He further added, "He's the heart of '83'!" Ranveer won the Best Actor award for '83' at the Filmfare Awards. The actor will next be seen in Karan Johar's 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani'.

91.title: Seat belt mandatory in rear seats but enforcement tough: Delhi traffic officials
91.article_body: Delhi traffic officials have stated that wearing seat belts for the rear seat passengers is mandatory, however, it is tough to enforce the law since traffic personnel can't check every car for violations. As per data shared by the department, over 1,900 people died in Delhi last year in road accidents involving the negligence of the driver or occupants.

92.title: Boats deployed to rescue residents from flooded Bengaluru areas, chaos at airport
92.article_body: Traffic was disrupted in several parts of Bengaluru due to heavy rains. According to reports, inflatable boats had to be brought out in some areas to rescue citizens. Chaos was also witnessed at the Bengaluru airport. A Twitter user shared a video from the airport and said, "I feel like crying seeing the state of infra in India."

93.title: Chahal is senior but Bishnoi bowled the tough overs: Gambhir
93.article_body: Ex-India opener Gautam Gambhir has praised spinner Ravi Bishnoi for his performance against Pakistan. "I think Bishnoi did a fabulous job...Bowling the fourth over and getting Babar out, bowling the 18th over...[Yuzvendra] Chahal is the senior, [but] he has actually bowled the easier overs as compared to someone like Bishnoi," stated Gambhir. Bishnoi registered figures of 1/26 in the match.

94.title: 2 women beaten to death with sticks over witchcraft suspicion in J'khand
94.article_body: Bodies of two women, who were allegedly killed over suspicion of practising witchcraft near Jharkhand's Ranchi, have been found. Reports said another woman is missing and search is on to find her. Police said the deceased appeared to have been hit with sticks and dumped in hilly area. "Police team was rushed to spot after we received information," police added.

95.title: UP truck driver's 2 wives die by suicide over financial constraints
95.article_body: Two wives of a truck driver allegedly died by suicide after consuming poison over financial constraints in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar on Sunday, police said. The truck of the deceased's husband had been apparently impounded by traffic department officials four months ago due to the non-completion of documents. The husband claimed that the truck was his only source of income.

96.title: Delhi man kills mother, then dies by suicide, 77-page suicide note found: Police
96.article_body: A 25-year-old man died by suicide on Sunday, days after killing his mother in Rohini, Delhi Police said. According to police, the man killed his mother two or three days ago and then killed himself with a knife on Sunday. Police said they also found a suicide note of about 77 pages.

97.title: SEIAA approves AIIMS revamp plan, 47% of trees at site to be removed
97.article_body: Delhi's State Environment Impact Assessment Authority (SEIAA) has given approval for the redevelopment of the All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS). The project will lead to the removal of 47% of trees at the site, noted SEIAA. Of the around 5,575 trees present at the AIIMS project site, 1,910 trees are to be transplanted and 731 will be cut.

98.title: CCTV footage shows Cyrus Mistry's car minutes before accident near Mumbai
98.article_body: CCTV footage has surfaced on social media showing former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry’s car, minutes before the accident near Mumbai. According to the preliminary probe, the car was overspeeding and the driver lost control while trying to overtake a vehicle from the left side. Mistry, who was seated in the back seat, was not wearing a seatbelt.

99.title: Apple to unveil new AirPods Pro 2 with H1 chip on Sept 7: Report
99.article_body: Apple is set to unveil the second generation of the AirPods Pro at its 'Far Out' event on September 7, Bloomberg's Mark Gurman has reported. He said, "The new AirPods Pro will update a model that first went on sale in...October 2019." The new AirPods will reportedly include Apple's next-generation H1 processor for improved audio quality and battery life.

100.title: Hackers steal actor Bill Murray's crypto after $185,000 charity auction
100.article_body: Hackers have stolen crypto worth more than $185,000 raised by actor and comedian Bill Murray as part of a charity auction. Murray had auctioned off a "Beer with Bill Murray" NFT on Wednesday, which was won by Coinbase user Brant Boersma for 119.2 ETH. Following the incident, the runner-up, Coinbase user Mishap72, donated 120 ETH to reimburse the charity.

101.title: Delhi reports 6th monkeypox case as 22-year-old woman tests positive
101.article_body: Sixth case of monkeypox disease has been detected in a 22-year-old woman of African origin in Delhi. Reports said that the woman was admitted to the isolation facility of Delhi government-run Lok Nayak Hospital (LNH) on August 31. She had arrived in India in January this year. She visited the hospital with complaints of fever, sore throat and skin lesions.

102.title: US woman calls 911 using smartwatch after she's stuck upside down in gym at 3 am
102.article_body: A woman in Ohio had to call 911 using her smartwatch after she got herself stuck upside down while using an inversion table at the gym around 3 am. The woman was recording herself doing the exercise on the inversion table, which suspends the body upside down to help relieve back pain. Her videos garnered millions of views on TikTok.

103.title: Jharkhand Assembly passes motion of confidence tabled by CM Hemant Soren
103.article_body: Jharkhand Assembly on Monday passed the motion of confidence moved by CM Hemant Soren. Forty-eight MLAs voted in favour and none voted against it as Opposition MLAs walked out of the Assembly. Soren was reportedly facing uncertainty over his continuance as Chief Minister following a petition by the BJP seeking his disqualification as an MLA in an office-of-profit case.

104.title: Vikram Vedha trailer to be shown before Brahmastra in cinemas: Report
104.article_body: The trailer of 'Vikram Vedha' will reportedly be shown before the shows of 'Brahmastra' in cinemas. A source stated, "The theatres have been asked to play the trailer just before 'Brahmastra' starts. The exhibitors have agreed to this request as they know that 'Vikram Vedha' looks like a potential hit." 'Vikram Vedha' will feature Hrithik Roshan and Saif Ali Khan.

105.title: Shah, Shinde & Fadnavis offer prayers to Mumbai's Lalbaugcha Raja
105.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah, Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde and the state Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis offered prayers to Lalbaugcha Raja in Mumbai on Monday. Shinde shared pictures and a video of the event which show Shah offering floral tribute. Other senior BJP leaders like Vinod Tawde and Chandrashekhar Bawankule were also present. "Feeling blessed!" Fadnavis tweeted.

106.title: He always made time if you wanted to meet: Snapdeal CEO on Mistry
106.article_body: Snapdeal CEO Kunal Bahl took to Twitter to mourn the death of former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry. "[He] always made time if you wanted to meet him and forever curious," Bahl said. OYO Rooms CEO Ritesh Agarwal said Mistry's demise is "an irreplaceable loss for the country". "His contributions to the nation's growth will always be remembered," Agarwal added.

107.title: Gurugram civic body to demarcate parking in major markets, govt buildings
107.article_body: In a move to curb haphazard parking in the city, the Municipal Corporation of Gurugram (MCG) is likely to demarcate dedicated parking areas by the next month, officials said. The demarcation will be done across all major markets, government buildings, community centres, parks, etc. The civic body will apply thermoplastic paint on roads for demarcating dedicated parking slots, officials added.

108.title: Teen stabs 40-year-old man to death after fight over momos in Delhi
108.article_body: A 40-year-old man was stabbed to death by a teenager following a fight over a plate of momos in Delhi's Ranhola on Saturday. The incident occurred when the victim's hand accidentally touched the teenager's hand and his plate fell. The accused, who was allegedly drunk, pulled out a knife and stabbed the victim on his neck before fleeing, police said.

109.title: RBI telling fintechs 'Don't do digital lending': Grover on RBI's new rules
109.article_body: BharatPe Co-founder Ashneer Grover has criticised the RBI's new digital lending guidelines, calling it the worst "regulatory innovation in the world". Grover wrote in a tweet, "RBI is telling fintechs 'Bhai mat karo digital lending shending'." The new rules bar lenders from storing borrowers' data and require direct transfer of disbursements and repayments between borrowers and regulated entities.

110.title: Three more matches, then we never have to play tennis: Kyrgios
110.article_body: After reaching the US Open quarterfinals for the first time, Australian tennis player Nick Kyrgios said, "I'm just glad I'm finally able to show New York my talent...I haven't had too many great trips here." He jokingly added, "Three more matches potentially...then we never have to play tennis again." Kyrgios defeated world number one Daniil Medvedev in his round-of-16 match.

111.title: You can love me, hate me; but don’t be indifferent to me: Karan Johar
111.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar has said that he does not fear failure, however, he fears indifference now. "Over the years, [the fear of being trolled] started diminishing. I am afraid that I may do something and no one would care about it," he further added. Karan's next directorial 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani' features Ranveer Singh and Alia Bhatt.

112.title: Protests held at 3 railway stations in WB seeking increased train frequency
112.article_body: Protests were staged at three railway stations in West Bengal's Hooghly district on Monday demanding increase in train service frequency to accommodate passenger rush. The protests were held at Khanyan, Palandu and Pandua stations with stones reportedly being hurled at a train in Khanyan. Railway officials stated services have been curtailed over ongoing work on a stretch of railway tracks.

113.title: We try to reach out to all but some leave after abusing us: Congress leader
113.article_body: Congress is a democratic party and it stands united, Congress' Jairam Ramesh said. "We try to take all people together. We try to reach out to all people but still, some leave after abusing us. I don't want to comment on them," Ramesh added. Furthermore, he said, "We don't silence voices. Those who are not satisfied issue statements. Some...write letters...tweet."

114.title: I feel like it’s a privilege: Mouni Roy on being part of 'Brahmastra'
114.article_body: Actress Mouni Roy has said that she feels it is a privilege to be a part of Ranbir Kapoor-starrer 'Brahmastra'. "It made so much of a difference in terms of the experience that I gained while shooting this film, the kinds of things that I have learned while shooting this film," she added. The film will also feature Alia Bhatt.

115.title: Ukraine's Shmyhal meets Germany's Scholz to discuss military aid
115.article_body: Ukrainian Prime Minister Denys Shmyhal met German Chancellor Olaf Scholz in Berlin on Sunday. Shmyhal acknowledged that Berlin stepped up military aid by providing heavy armaments like the howitzer 2000 and rocket launchers. Ukrainian PM, who was welcomed with military honours, is the first high-level Ukrainian official to visit Germany in several months.

116.title: Scam worth over ₹100 crore found in Madhya Pradesh govt's free food scheme: Report
116.article_body: According to a report by Madhya Pradesh's Accountant General, irregularities worth over ₹100 crore in the identification of beneficiaries and in the production and distribution of Take Home Ration (THR) have surfaced in the state's nutrition programme. Notably, even the trucks that were claimed to have been used for ration transportation were found to be motorcycles, cars, autos and tankers.

117.title: BBMP identifies 696 encroachments in Bengaluru, issues notices
117.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has identified 696 encroachments in the city and issued notices to 32 people. The action comes after CM Basavaraj Bommai directed authorities to remove properties encroaching on the drains after he visited flooded areas. The highest number of 175 encroachments were reported in Mahadevapura area followed by 126 encroachments in Dasarahalli.

118.title: Tharoor met Gehlot to discuss about AICC Presidential polls: Reports
118.article_body: According to reports, senior Congress leader Shashi Tharoor met Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot in Delhi and discussed about the party's future as well as the upcoming AICC Presidential polls. Earlier last week, Gehlot had said that efforts will be made till the last minute to persuade Rahul Gandhi to take over the reins of the party again.

119.title: Some plunge into poll battle just 5 months earlier with huge promises: Shah
119.article_body: Union Minister Amit Shah on Sunday said that some people plunge into the poll battle just about five months earlier with huge promises against others who work hard for five years, before asking for votes. Shah made the remark in Ahmedabad without naming anyone. He inaugurated four smart schools in Ahmedabad city on Sunday.

120.title: Mumbai school principal to be conferred with National Award by President
120.article_body: Principal of a Mumbai school, Kavita Sanghvi, is set to be conferred with the National Award by President Droupadi Murmu on the occasion of Teacher’s Day. She joined 45 other educators from across the country in the honours list. “It’s going to be a very special event for me as it is recognition of my hard work,” said Sanghvi.

121.title: Las Vegas investigative journalist stabbed to death outside home
121.article_body: A 69-year-old investigative journalist, Jeff German, was stabbed to death outside his house in US' Las Vegas, authorities said. A police spokesperson said that police believe that an altercation had taken place, adding, "We do have some leads. We're pursuing a suspect but the suspect is outstanding." The city's Mayor Carolyn G Goodman called it a "senseless act of violence".

122.title: Speculative: Federal Bank on report claiming its merger with Kotak Bank
122.article_body: Reacting to a media report claiming its merger with Kotak Mahindra Bank, Federal Bank clarified that the report is "speculative in nature". In an exchange filing, it said that there was "no such information available with the company". Earlier, a report while quoting sources said that the top management of both banks had met for a potential deal.

123.title: I was scared about not wearing any makeup in 'Maharani': Huma Qureshi
123.article_body: Actress Huma Qureshi said she was scared about not wearing makeup in the series 'Maharani'. "In season 2, at least I'm the chief minister so I'm in better clothes. In season 1, I...had rubber slippers, dirty synthetic saree that I would pull up...tuck in (above the stomach)," she stated. Huma revealed she was "petrified" when she heard the show's script.

124.title: Kitten rescued from burning building in Ukraine; video surfaces
124.article_body: A video of firefighters rescuing a kitten from a burning building in Ukraine has surfaced online. According to the country's emergency services, the rescuers pulled out the kitten from the rubble of the hotel-restaurant complex that was hit by a rocket, which in turn had caused the fire, in Kharkiv. The video shows the firefighters petting and cuddling the kitten.

125.title: If we had more wickets in hand, I would've tried to hit more sixes: Kohli
125.article_body: Talking about his 60(44) against Pakistan, Virat Kohli said he made a "conscious effort to strike at a higher pace" but he ended up in a situation where he had to "go deep". He added, "When we lost wickets, there was communication and our plans changed...if there were a couple of batters, I would've gone with the same tempo."

126.title: Robbers pose as income tax officials, loot ₹25 lakh from Ludhiana farmer
126.article_body: Four men posed as income tax officials to raid the house of a Ludhiana farmer and seized ₹25 lakh before leaving. The victim stated in his complaint he had sold 21-acre land and kept part of the money at home to buy more land. He said some of the robbers were carrying pistols and locked the family in a room.

127.title: Church must show zero tolerance: Pope on sexual abuse by clergy
127.article_body: Pope Francis said during an interview on Sunday that the Catholic Church must show "zero tolerance" over sexual abuse by the clergy. "A priest cannot continue being a priest if he is an aggressor. He cannot because he is either sick or a criminal," he added. He further said that such an act is "monstrous" as it destroys lives.

128.title: Will speak to B'luru IT companies regarding ₹225 cr loss due to rain: CM Bommai
128.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Monday said that he will call Bengaluru-based IT and banking companies which said that they collectively lost ₹225 crore due to the flooding of Outer Ring Road. "I will speak with them related to issues they're facing (due to waterlogging). We'll also discuss the compensation and other related damages caused due to rain," he added.

129.title: BYJU'S to raise over $500 million at $23 billion valuation: Report
129.article_body: Edtech platform BYJU'S is likely to raise more than $500 million at a valuation of $23 billion in a week, PTI reported. BYJU'S is reportedly in talks with Abu Dhabi's sovereign wealth funds to raise $400-500 million and with Qatar Investment Authority (QIA) to raise $250-350 million. The company is mulling over using funds for acquisition in the US.

130.title: Last rites of Karnataka police dog conducted with full state honours
130.article_body: The Karnataka Police on Sunday conducted the last rites of a service dog who served the department for over 11 years with full state honours. Geetha, an 11-year-old labrador retriever dog, passed away on Saturday following prolonged illness. Geetha was deployed extensively in the security and explosive detection work during the arrival of VVIPs and other huge public gatherings..

131.title: Paytm shares fall over 6% in early trade after ED raid in Chinese loan apps probe
131.article_body: Shares of Paytm’s parent company One 97 Communications declined over 6% in Monday's early trade. The Enforcement Directorate had conducted a raid at the company's Bengaluru premises over the weekend in connection with a Chinese loan apps case. At the day's low of ₹681.20, the share price was trading at a discount of 68% from its issue price of ₹2,150.

132.title: Bed Bath & Beyond CFO was sued over $1.2bn loss to shareholders days before death
132.article_body: Bed Bath & Beyond CFO Gustavo Arnal, who died after jumping from NYC's 'Jenga Building' on Friday, was sued by a group of shareholders on August 23, court documents show. The lawsuit accused Arnal and major shareholder Ryan Cohen of artificially inflating the firm's stock price through a 'pump and dump' scheme. The shareholders claimed they lost around $1.2 billion.

133.title: Why is he sitting on CM post?: Annie Raja on Soren's 'incidents happen' remark
133.article_body: General Secretary of National Federation of Indian Women (NFIW) Annie Raja criticised Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren for his "incidents happen" remark while responding to a question on a tribal girl’s rape and murder in Dumka. "Why is he sitting on the CM post? He is there to ensure that this kind of incident is prevented," Raja said.

134.title: Lucknow man arrested for 'love jihad', raping, assaulting wife
134.article_body: A 39-year-old gym owner in Lucknow has been arrested for marrying a woman by allegedly concealing his identity and posing as a Hindu man. The accused married her in a temple and later forced her to change her religion, threatening her with dire consequences, police said. The victim has further accused him of rape and having unnatural sex with her.

135.title: Euro declines below $0.99 for the first time in 20 years
135.article_body: The euro fell below $0.99 for the first time in 20 years on Monday, after Russia shut down a major gas pipeline to Europe. The currency fell as much as 0.7% to a low of $0.9888 in afternoon trading in Asia. Earlier, the US dollar index hit 110.086 in Asia's morning trade, reaching a new two-decade high.

136.title: Azad twisting facts, distorting history to gain sympathy from people of J&K: Cong
136.article_body: Congress General Secretary of Communications Jairam Ramesh said that former Congress leader Ghulam Nabi Azad is twisting facts and distorting history in order to generate undue sympathy from the people of Jammu and Kashmir. He further said Azad's claims of being a politician connected with people is a lie, adding he never won any election other than an assembly by-election.

137.title: MBT member posts fake news about Raja Singh, detained in Hyderabad
137.article_body: A member of the political party Majlis Bachao Tehreek (MBT) was detained in Hyderabad for allegedly posting fake news about suspended BJP leader T Raja Singh. The accused had claimed in the post that Singh, who has been jailed under the Preventive Detention Act, will be released on Monday. Singh was jailed after being accused of insulting Prophet Muhammad.

138.title: 2 killed, at least 5 trapped in fire at Hotel Levana in Lucknow
138.article_body: Two people were killed after a fire broke out in Hotel Levana in Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow. Reports said that 20 people have been rescued. However, five to six people are still feared trapped inside the hotel building. The fire broke out on Monday morning. Eyewitnesses said that several guests tried escaping the hotel by breaking the windows of their rooms.

139.title: Working on 'Aashiqui 3' is like dream come true: Actor Kartik Aaryan
139.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan, who will be featuring in 'Aashiqui 3', has said that working on the film is a "dream come true" for him. "The timeless classic 'Aashiqui' is something I grew up watching...I feel privileged yet grateful for collaborating with Bhushan Kumar and Mukesh Bhatt for this opportunity," he added. The film will be directed by Anurag Basu.

140.title: Gurugram's Appu Ghar sealed over non payment of dues of over ₹48.56 cr
140.article_body: The Haryana Shehri Vikas Pradhikaran (HSVP) has sealed Appu Ghar amusement park in Gurugram over alleged non-payment of dues of over ₹48.56 crore including penalties. An official said several notices had been served to the amusement park authorities and that they have defaulted on the payment. The park operator's lease agreement was also terminated earlier.

141.title: Mumbai businessman booked for allegedly forging ID card of DRDO
141.article_body: Mumbai police has booked a 72-year-old businessman for possessing a fake identity card of the Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO). The man allegedly created the bogus ID to get his work done quickly at the passport office. He was booked for pretending to be an official and carrying a token used by officials with fraudulent intent.

142.title: Mumbai Traffic Police asked not to use personal phones for snapping violators
142.article_body: The Additional Director General of Police (Traffic) issued notification warning Mumbai Traffic Police against use of personal mobile phones to issue e-challans to violators. The ADG asked traffic police to use cameras on the e-challan machines to click photos. There were several complaints that vehicle photos clicked on personal mobile phones were not appropriate and uploaded late, the ADG said.

143.title: K'taka government to investigate scams under Congress rule: Ravi
143.article_body: BJP National General Secretary CT Ravi claimed that the Karnataka government will investigate all the scams that took place under the previous Congress regime. "Many scams during the Congress government have been covered up. There was a long discussion in the meeting about uncovering and investigating such scams and taking strict action against the culprits," said Ravi.

144.title: SpaceX launches 51 Starlink satellites in its 40th mission of 2022
144.article_body: SpaceX has successfully launched a batch of 51 Starlink satellites completing its 40th mission of 2022. Seattle-based company Spaceflight's space tug Sherpa-LTC2 was also onboard with the Starlink satellites. Last week, SpaceX CEO Elon Musk said the firm is launching Starlink satellites roughly every five days now and plans to launch 100 orbital missions in 2023.

145.title: 8 die climbing volcano in Russia, strong winds delay rescue
145.article_body: Eight people lost their lives while climbing the Klyuchevskaya Sopka volcano in Russia's far east, according to Interfax news agency. A group of 12 people, including two guides, had set out to climb a 4,754 metre volcano on Tuesday but some climbers fell from 4,200 metres, authorities said. Rescuers returned amid strong winds which prevented their helicopter from landing.

146.title: Have finally seen every shot in Brahmāstra, emotional moment for me: Ayan
146.article_body: Taking to Instagram, 'Brahmāstra' director Ayan Mukerji shared a behind-the-scenes clip from the sets of the film. Along with the video, Ayan wrote, "Yesterday was the first time, I saw every shot in 'Brahmāstra' - finally finished, polished and ready for its audience." He added that it was an emotional moment for him as the journey was "long and challenging".

147.title: Strong speech: Tharoor after Rahul addressed Congress' rally in Delhi
147.article_body: After Congress leader Rahul Gandhi addressed the ‘Mehangai par halla bol’ rally in Delhi on Sunday, Congress' Shashi Tharoor tweeted "strong speech". Tharoor added, "A strong speech...roused huge crowds thronging Ramlila Maidan. Now to take message across the country in Bharat Jodo Yatra." Gandhi in his speech said, "I want to tell PM Modi, I'm not scared of your ED."

148.title: India reports 5,910 new COVID-19 cases and 16 deaths, positivity rate at 2.60%
148.article_body: India has reported 5,910 new COVID-19 cases and nine deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Health Ministry. Additionally, seven reconciled deaths from earlier period were added in Kerala. This comes a day after the country recorded 6,809 COVID-19 cases. Active cases in the country dropped to 53,974, while the daily positivity rate stood at 2.60%.

149.title: Just stared at ceiling till 5 am, thought my career is over: Kohli on CT 2009 match vs Pak
149.article_body: On being asked about Arshdeep Singh being criticised for dropping a catch against Pakistan in Asia Cup match, Virat Kohli said, "Everyone makes mistakes under pressure." He stated, "I remember...I got out playing...bad shot against Shahid Afridi in my first Champions Trophy match in 2009." He added, "[After the match]...I just stared at...ceiling till 5 am...thought my career is over."

150.title: Rohit Sharma gets angry at Rishabh Pant in dressing room after his wicket, video viral
150.article_body: A video of Team India captain Rohit Sharma getting angry at Rishabh Pant after the latter's dismissal against Pakistan in their Asia Cup 2022 Super 4 stage match has gone viral. In the video, Rohit can be seen seemingly scolding Pant about his shot selection. Pant was dismissed for 14(12) after playing a reverse sweep against Shadab Khan.

151.title: Shame on people saying cheap things about him: Harbhajan on Arshdeep getting abused
151.article_body: Ex-India off-spinner Harbhajan Singh took to Twitter to defend pacer Arshdeep Singh after he was abused on social media for dropping a catch against Pakistan during India's five-wicket defeat on Sunday. "Stop criticising young Arshdeep...No one [drops] the catch purposely...Shame on...people who [are] putting our own guys down by saying cheap things...about Arsh and team...Arsh is GOLD," he added.

152.title: I'll always wear seat belt, even when in rear seat: Mahindra after Mistry's death
152.article_body: Businessman Anand Mahindra tweeted, "I resolve to always wear my seat belt even when in the rear seat of the car," after former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry was killed in a road accident near Mumbai on Sunday. Mistry was in the backseat and wasn't wearing his seat belt when the overspeeding car hit a divider, preliminary police probe found.

153.title: Traffic restrictions in Mumbai's western suburbs due to VVIP visit
153.article_body: Mumbai police has rolled out traffic restrictions due to a scheduled VVIP visit. The movement will be slow at Malabar Hill, Babulnath, Kemp's Corner, Haji Ali, Mahalaxmi Race Course, Saat Rasta, Chinchpokli Junction, Lalbaug Parel, Lotus Junction, Worli Dairy, Worli Sea Link and Lilavati Junction areas between 9 am to 12:30 pm.

154.title: Woman constable booked in Punjab's Mohali for cheating, impersonation
154.article_body: A woman constable posted with Cyber Crime Cell has been booked in Punjab's Mohali for allegedly impersonating another police personnel and lodging fake complaints with senior officers. The accused lodged complaints in order to defame the personnel, police said. The incident came to light when an inquiry was conducted by an ADGP level officer following which the case was registered.

155.title: Man climbs one of the tallest buildings in UK, shares selfie from the top; arrested
155.article_body: A 21-year-old man was arrested on suspicion of trespass in London after he was seen climbing one of the tallest buildings in the UK on Sunday. The man, believed to be free climber Adam Lockwood, scaled the 1,017 ft-tall skyscraper, called 'The Shard', barefoot. He later posted a selfie on Facebook from the top of the building, captioned, "Shard, 04/09/2022."

156.title: Tamil Nadu minister V Senthil Balaji's Twitter account hacked briefly
156.article_body: Tamil Nadu Minister of Electricity, Prohibition and Excise V Senthil Balaji's Twitter account was briefly hacked on Sunday but got restored later in the day. The account showed a different display name and requested people to make use of cryptocurrencies. He later thanked state cyber crime wing and Twitter officials for restoring his account which has over two lakh followers.

157.title: Most sedition cases in last 8 years came from Assam: NCRB data
157.article_body: A National Crime Records Bureau (NCRB) report stated that 76 sedition cases were registered across the country in 2021 which is a marginal increase from the 73 registered in 2020. Most of the sedition cases in the last eight years have come from Assam, the report stated. The number of cases stood at 93 in 2019 and 70 in 2018.

158.title: Restoration of full statehood of J&K, right to land priority: Azad
158.article_body: Veteran politician Ghulam Nabi Azad, who recently quit Congress citing Rahul Gandhi's "immaturity", has stated that the restoration of full statehood of Jammu and Kashmir will be the priority of his new party. He said that no one from outside Jammu and Kashmir shall be allowed to purchase land there and no jobs shall go to outsiders.

159.title: Boat carrying 55 people capsizes in Ganga river in Bihar's Danapur, 10 people missing
159.article_body: A boat carrying 55 people capsized in Bihar's Danapur on Sunday. Reports said that 10 people are missing and the search operation is underway. The incident took place while the labourers were returning from work. News agency ANI reported that people gathered around the river soon after the news of the sinking of the boat spread.

160.title: World no. 1 Medvedev crashes out of US Open, loses to Kyrgios
160.article_body: Defending champion and world number one Daniil Medvedev has crashed out of the US Open after losing to Australian Nick Kyrgios in their round-of-16 match. Notably, this is the first time Kyrgios has reached the quarterfinals at Flushing Meadows. "I want to go all the way," said Kyrgios after winning the match with a scoreline of 7-6(13-11), 3-6, 6-3, 6-2.

161.title: Thunderstorms cause flash floods in US' Georgia; emergency declared
161.article_body: Thunderstorms and heavy rainfall caused flash flooding in US' Georgia, following which the state Governor Brian P Kemp declared a state of emergency in Chattooga and Floyd Counties. According to Kemp's order, the area received an estimated 12 inches of rainfall which caused rivers to "rise rapidly". The National Weather Service said that the situation is "extremely dangerous and life-threatening".

162.title: Hardcore, loyal Shiv Sainiks will fight back: Ex-Maha CM Thackeray
162.article_body: Former Maharashtra CM and Shiv Sena chief Uddhav Thackeray on Sunday said "loyal and hardcore" Shiv Sainiks will fight back against the current political situation. Thackeray was addressing the members of the Vahatuk Sena, the transport wing of the party, at his residence. Thackeray said he has received 11,000 new membership forms and affidavits from the Vahatuk Sena.

163.title: Anand & 1.5L other Indians managed genetic hair fall: Traya
163.article_body: Anand from Nashik covered his bald patch in 5 months, shared Traya, revealing that it has found a breakthrough in managing genetic hairfall. Internal factors like stress, nutrition and digestion accelerate balding, therefore it combines 3 sciences- ayurveda, dermatology and nutrition to target these root causes, Traya stated. It offers an online hair test to build a customized treatment plan.

164.title: Bengaluru Police shares list of roads to avoid due to waterlogging
164.article_body: As heavy rain lashed out Bengaluru, the HSR Layout Traffic Police shared list of roads to avoid due to waterlogging and suggested people to use alternative roads. The police asked commuters to avoid - Outer Ring Road, Sarjapura road, Doddakannelli road, Bellandur road. The Outer Ring Road (ORR) was flooded for the second time in a week.

165.title: Cyrus Mistry was brought dead with a head injury after accident: Doctor
165.article_body: Former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry was brought dead to the hospital and had received a head injury during the accident, said a doctor who attended to him at a government hospital in Kasa. He added that his co-passenger Jehangir Pandole died during the transit. According to the police, the accident happened as the driver lost control because of overspeeding.

166.title: Carnival swing with 50 people on board crashes down from 50 feet in Punjab; video surfaces
166.article_body: A swing with nearly 50 people on board broke mid-air and crashed down from a height of 50 feet during a fair in Punjab's Mohali on Sunday, ANI reported. According to The Indian Express, at least 15 people, mostly children and women, were injured in the incident. The injured persons were shifted to a hospital after the incident, reports said.

167.title: People trying to give Patkar backdoor entry into Guj politics: Shah
167.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah has criticised AAP, claiming that some people were trying to give activist Medha Patkar a "backdoor entry" into Gujarat politics. "Those who want to bring...Patkar, who opposed Gujarat and our lifeline Narmada project...should stop here itself. There's no place for those opposing Gujarat," he added. Patkar was fielded by AAP in 2014 Lok Sabha elections.

168.title: Out of all I've played with before, only MSD messaged me when I quit Test captaincy: Kohli
168.article_body: During a press conference after India-Pakistan match on Sunday, Virat Kohli said out of all the players he has played with before, only MS Dhoni messaged him when he quit Test captaincy. "A lot of [other former] players have my number...A lot of people give suggestions on TV...but no one messaged me," he added, taking a dig at his critics.

169.title: This game was as valuable as a final: Rizwan on Pak's win vs India
169.article_body: After defeating India in their Asia Cup Super 4 stage match, Pakistan wicketkeeper-batter Muhammad Rizwan said the game was as valuable as a final to them. "The whole world [was] watching...we have power-hitters who are capable of hitting around 45 runs off the last four overs. So we didn't panic," he added. Pakistan chased down India's 181-run total to win.

170.title: Road caves in due to heavy rainfall in Kerala's Wayanad, video surfaces
170.article_body: A part of a road caved in, in Kerala's Wayanad district, as heavy rainfall lashed the area. A video of the incident has surfaced. In the video, several people can be seen walking towards the part of the road that got washed away with flowing water. Reports added that all paddy fields have been flooded due to heavy rainfall.

171.title: Fire breaks out at Lucknow's Hotel Levana; rescue ops on, 3 ambulances on standby
171.article_body: A fire broke out at Hotel Levana in Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow on Monday. News agency ANI reported that firefighting and rescue operations are underway. Three ambulances and fire tenders are present at the spot. Meanwhile, security personnel are taking the help of oxygen masks to enter the building to evacuate people stuck in their hotel rooms.

172.title: Fire breaks out near Delhi's Chandni Chowk, over 100 fire officers deployed
172.article_body: A fire broke out in a building near the Chandni Chowk metro station in Delhi on Sunday night. Reports said that over 100 fire officers have been deployed and 35 fire tenders are present on the spot. An official said that the fire has been doused and cooling is being done from outside.

173.title: Mistry & Pandoles were returning from a Parsi pilgrimage site when accident occurred
173.article_body: Former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry was accompanied by his three family friends from the Pandole family when the accident occurred. They were returning from a Parsi pilgrimage site in Udwada, where they had gone to offer prayers following the death of Darius and Jehangir Pandole's father Dinshaw Pandole last week. Jehangir and Mistry didn't survive the accident.

174.title: BJP wanted to make RCP Singh Bihar's Eknath Shinde: Nitish Kumar
174.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Sunday said BJP wanted to make ex-JD(U) leader RCP Singh the Eknath Shinde of Bihar and isolate the JD(U) party. Earlier, after the collapse of the MVA government in Maharashtra, Shinde was sworn in as the CM. Kumar’s statement came during the national executive council meeting of JD(U) which was held in Patna.
