175.title: Problems of India don't feature in B'wood films now: Pallavi Joshi
175.article_body: Speaking about Bollywood films not working, 'The Kashmir Files' actress Pallavi Joshi opined that the films don't feature India's problems, due to which there is a disconnect with the audience. "If you see the films of Raj Kapoor, Manoj Kumar, Sunil Dutt, they mirrored whatever was happening around in the society," she said. 'The Kashmir Files' also featured Anupam Kher.

176.title: First metro pier comes up inside Bengaluru airport campus
176.article_body: The first metro pier inside premises of Bengaluru's Kempegowda International Airport was cast on Saturday. The 15-km-long route from Yelahanka to the Airport terminal station will have a total of 67 piers. Casting of the first pier, which has a height of 8 metres and a diameter running to 1.6 metres, was completed within three hours, officials said.

177.title: Rohit Sharma's 'angry' reaction to Arshdeep dropping catch against Pakistan goes viral
177.article_body: India captain Rohit Sharma's reaction to pacer Arshdeep Singh dropping Asif Ali's catch in 18th over of Pakistan's innings in their Asia Cup 2022 Super 4 stage match went viral. In the video, Rohit can be seen reacting furiously. Asif was batting on 0* when Arshdeep dropped his catch on Ravi Bishnoi's bowling. Asif went on to score 16(8).

178.title: Rachakonda CP calls for cooperation over immersion of Ganesh idols
178.article_body: Rachakonda CP Mahesh Bhagwat on Sunday urged devotees to cooperate with the police to complete the immersion of Ganesh idols peacefully. He also inspected the arrangements for the same at Saroornagar lake, saying that "full-proof" arrangements have been made by police. He added that the police will work round the clock in Rachakonda limits till immersion reach the last phase.

179.title: 'I'm devastated by the horrific attacks', says Canada PM Trudeau as 10 stabbed to death
179.article_body: Canada's Prime Minister Justin Trudeau has said, "I am shocked and devastated by the horrific attacks today in James Smith Cree Nation and Weldon, Saskatchewan, that claimed the lives of 10 people and injured many more." He added, "As Canadians, we mourn with everyone affected by this tragic violence, and with the people of Saskatchewan."

180.title: Virat's form is brilliant, his 60(44) vs Pak was crucial for the team: Rohit
180.article_body: Team India captain Rohit Sharma praised Virat Kohli for his 60-run innings against Pakistan in their Asia Cup match on Sunday. "Needed someone to bat long when the others were getting out. Virat batted with that tempo...Virat getting that score was crucial from the team's point of view," said Rohit. India posted 181/7 but lost the match by five wickets.

181.title: Who are the Pandoles, Cyrus Mistry's co-passengers during the road accident?
181.article_body: Former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry was accompanied by three family friends during the accident. While the car was driven by Dr Anahita Pandole, a top gynaecologist in Mumbai, her husband Darius Pandole, JM Financial Private Equity's CEO, was seated in front. Darius' brother, Jehangir, a top executive at KPMG, was seated in the back and didn't survive the accident.

182.title: BEST imposes ₹3 crore fine on pvt agency for keeping mini AC buses off roads
182.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Electric Supply and Transport (BEST) imposed a fine of ₹3 crore on a private agency, two days after 280 mini air-conditioned BEST buses, that have been wet-leased from the private agency, went off the roads. Wet-leased buses are owned by private contractors, who also appoint their drivers and take care of maintenance and insurance of the vehicles.

183.title: 69 fatal spots mapped in Delhi saw 5 accidents per km in last 2 years: Data
183.article_body: The Delhi Transport Department has identified about 69 fatal crash spots across the city. Reports said that these fatal spots have seen more than five accidents per kilometre in the last two years. The data also shows that there are about five corridors which have seen more than two pedestrian deaths per kilometre.

184.title: Cyrus Mistry was not wearing a seat belt, car covered 20km in 9 minutes: Police
184.article_body: Former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry was not wearing a seat belt when the car he was travelling in hit a divider, killing him and his co-passenger Jahangir Pandole, preliminary police probe found. The car was overspeeding and had covered 20km in just 9 minutes, police said. Mistry and Pandole, who were sitting in the backseat, suffered injuries to head.

185.title: 10 killed, 15 hospitalised in mass stabbing incident in Canada
185.article_body: At least 10 people were killed and 15 others were hospitalised after a stabbing spree in Saskatchewan province in Canada on Sunday. Police said they were investigating 13 locations and looking for two "armed and dangerous" suspects. While some of the victims seem to have been targeted by the suspects, others may have been attacked randomly, the police further said.

186.title: 4 members of same family booked for assaulting bus driver in Pune
186.article_body: The driver of a Pune Mahanagar Parivahan Mahamandal Limited (PMPML) bus was allegedly assaulted by four members of a family in an incident of road rage on Shankarsheth Road in Pune. Police have booked the accused family members, who had also allegedly verbally abused the conductor and ticket supervisor of the bus.

187.title: Rashford scores 2 as Man Utd hand Arsenal their 1st defeat in PL this season
187.article_body: Marcus Rashford scored a brace as Manchester United beat Premier League leaders Arsenal 3-1 to hand the London club their first loss of the season. United's €100m summer signing, Antony started the match and opened the scoring for the home team in the 35th minute. Arsenal's Bukayo Saka equalised in the 60th minute, before Rashford's brace won United the match.

188.title: Pakistan beat India in Asia Cup, record their highest successful T20I chase against them
188.article_body: Pakistan on Sunday handed India their first defeat in Asia Cup 2022 by registering a five-wicket victory in their Super 4 stage match. Pakistan chased down a target of 182 in 19.5 overs to record their highest-ever successful run chase in T20I cricket against India. Muhammad Rizwan top-scored for Pakistan in the match with 71 runs off 51 deliveries.

189.title: Draft order for Gorakhpur changes 'Muslim-sounding names' of wards
189.article_body: A draft delimitation order by UP's Gorakhpur Municipal Corporation has changed "Muslim-sounding names" of wards in the district. Mayor Sitaram Jaiswal said the new names evoke a feeling of pride with Ilahi Bagh now known as Bandhu Singh Nagar, Ismailpur as Sahabganj and other such changes. An official said objections to the order can be filed within a week.

190.title: Back-to-back 50s, this one is better than the other: Mishra on Kohli's 60
190.article_body: Reacting to India batter Virat Kohli's 60 off 44 deliveries against Pakistan in Super 4 stage match at Asia Cup 2022, Amit Mishra said, "Back-to-back half-centuries...this one is better than the other." He tweeted, "Placed his innings with calculated aggression and some good quality shots. GOAT for a reason." Kohli scored 59* (44) against Hong Kong in group stage match.

191.title: Kabir Bedi conferred with Lifetime Achievement Award at Venice
191.article_body: Kabir Bedi was honoured on Saturday with the Filming Italy Movie Lifetime Achievement Award at Venice. Bedi, who has done over six major series in Italy, said not many people realise that "Bollywood and Hollywood are a far lesser part of my life than my career in Italy". He thanked Italians for giving him the opportunity to star in 'Sandokan'.

192.title: My journey is 70% failure, 30% success: Rubina Dilaik
192.article_body: Rubina Dilaik described her journey as a mix of "70% failure and 30% success". She said she believes it is "important to fail otherwise one wouldn't understand the meaning of success". Rubina, who said her priority is to do "impactful work", added that if television offers her "creatively satisfying" projects, she will always choose to come back to the medium.

193.title: You screwed me: Lewis Hamilton to Mercedes on finishing 4th
193.article_body: Mercedes F1 driver Lewis Hamilton went on an expletive-filled rant during the 2022 Dutch GP as he lost his race lead to end fourth. "That was the biggest f**k up. I can't believe you screwed me like that. I can't describe how pi**ed I am," Hamilton said on the team radio. Red Bull's Max Verstappen won the Grand Prix.

194.title: Filmmakers used to call me finest, but nothing translated into work: Shefali
194.article_body: Shefali Shah said that her potential as an actress was "not tapped well" before 'Delhi Crime'. The actress said that while she had always received appreciation, it never translated into work. "There were directors and filmmakers who used to say I am the finest actress but then nothing in terms of getting work," she said.

195.title: Keita, Chamberlain left out of Liverpool's UCL group stage squad
195.article_body: Liverpool midfielders Naby Keita and Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain have been left out of the club's 2022-23 UEFA Champions League group stage squad. Both players are suffering from a muscle injury and are ineligible to be added again until January. Liverpool will travel to Napoli for their Champions League Group A opening match on September 7.

196.title: Azad twisting facts in his favour to befool people of J&K: Congress
196.article_body: Congress on Sunday hit back at Ghulam Nabi Azad accusing him of working at the behest of his "political bosses". Congress general secretary Jairam Ramesh said that Azad was twisting facts to befool the people of J&K. It doesn't make sense for Azad to spread lies in public after parting ways with Congress, he said.

197.title: Ralph Lauren shares pics of JLo's 3 wedding gowns that featured pearls, crystals
197.article_body: Designer Ralph Lauren has shared new details and pictures of the three custom-made gowns that actress Jennifer Lopez wore during her second wedding with actor Ben Affleck. She walked down the aisle in a gown made with over 1,000 hand-cut handkerchiefs using 1,640 feet of fabric. The other two gowns featured silk tulle, pearls and Swarovski crystals, the designer said.

198.title: Haven’t made any monetary gains from ‘Kala Chashma’ buzz: Singer Amar
198.article_body: Singer Amar Arshi said that while his song 'Kala Chashma' is trending on the internet, he hasn't made "any monetary gains from it". He said many people don't even know that the original version of the song, which was released in 1991, was sung by him. "I didn't think the song will become this big," he added.

199.title: Virat Kohli's 6-week-long break has helped him: Ravi Shastri
199.article_body: Former India head coach Ravi Shastri said the six-week-long break Virat Kohli took by skipping the West Indies and Zimbabwe tours has had a positive impact. "Kohli looks a lot calmer, he needed that break," said Shastri. Kohli has scored 154 runs with two half-centuries in the three Asia Cup 2022 matches he has played so far.

200.title: Fundamentalists trying to influence, but Muslims have cooperated: Assam DGP
200.article_body: Assam DGP Bhaskar Jyoti Mahanta said that four main organisations running most of the madrasas in the state have been told to conduct a survey of the institutions within six months. "Fundamentalist forces are trying to influence [Assam's] Muslims...but the community, by and large, have cooperated, with only a minuscule percentage falling prey to the radical doctrines," Mahanta said.

201.title: 13 sand-laden tractors cross Agra toll plaza within 50 seconds by breaking barrier
201.article_body: As many as 13 sand-laden tractor-trolleys of alleged mining mafia broke the barricading at a toll plaza on the Agra-Gwalior highway in Uttar Pradesh and reportedly crossed it within 52 seconds. According to Agra Police, a case has been registered in this connection and further legal action is being undertaken. CCTV footage of the incident has surfaced online.

202.title: 3 labourers run over by train in Punjab's Ludhiana
202.article_body: Three labourers were run over by a train when they were trying to cross a rail track near Dhandari Kalan in Punjab's Ludhiana district on Sunday. The deceased labourers are yet to be identified and all of them died on the spot, a Government Railway Police official said. The deceased labourers were run over by the Ludhiana-Ambala passenger train.

203.title: I am declared dead in govt records, couldn't even withdraw pension: 70-year-old UP man
203.article_body: A 70-year-old man in Uttar Pradesh's Shahjahanpur district claimed he's being denied old-age pension as he has been "declared dead" in government records. "As I'm dead in government records...I couldn't even withdraw money from bank. My cane crop is affected as I couldn't irrigate it due to lack of money," he said. Officials stated that they are probing the matter.

204.title: Incidents happen, where don't they: Jharkhand CM on 14-yr-old tribal girl's rape, murder
204.article_body: Responding to questions on a 14-year-old tribal girl's rape and murder in Dumka, Jharkhand Chief Minister Hemant Soren said, "Incidents happen...where do they not occur?" He added, "Incidents don’t come with a warning." The body of the girl was found hanging from a tree on Saturday. The accused, Armaan Ansari, was arrested on Sunday.

205.title: The view that India shouldn't interfere in world's problems must change: Jaishankar
205.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar has said the idea that India shouldn't interfere if any problem arises in the world, is a "dogma" that must change. "Maybe in 1950-60, we didn't have the capability (to interfere)...But now...we've reached number five in the world in economy," said Jaishankar. An entity ranked number five shouldn't think like one ranked 20, he added.

206.title: Hitting half-century with a 6, King Kohli style: Raina on Kohli's 60 vs Pak
206.article_body: After Virat Kohli hit a 44-ball 60 against Pakistan in the Super 4 stage match at Asia Cup 2022 today, Suresh Raina tweeted, "Hitting a half-century with a six, King Kohli style." "Playing with such calm and aggression at the same time, good going brother," he added. Notably, it is the 33-year-old Team India batter's 32nd T20I fifty.

207.title: Filmmakers making 'bakwas' content, not investing in stories: Prakash on B'wood
207.article_body: Filmmaker Prakash Jha said Bollywood is relying on making remakes. "They are just making remakes. If you don't have [an original] story to tell, stop making films," he said. He added that filmmakers need to understand that they are "making bakwas (crap)" and "not investing in stories and content". He added the makers need to work hard and "think original".

208.title: I can adopt, I can do IVF, I am open to everything: Vidyut on parenthood
208.article_body: Actor Vidyut Jammwal, who got engaged to fashion designer Nandita Mahtani, opened up about his views on parenthood. He said that children are a "divine plan" and he's open to all ways of having a child. "I can adopt, I can do IVF, surrogacy," he added. "If it's meant to be in your life, it'll come to you," said Vidyut.

209.title: 16 idols stolen from ancient Jain temple in UP's Lalitpur
209.article_body: Sixteen idols and their four umbrellas were stolen from the ancient Jain temple located in Paroli village in Lalitpur, UP on Saturday. A case has been registered against unknown thieves and an investigation has been launched, police said. Notably, a team from the Narhat Police Station, personnel from the Special Operations Group and surveillance are being deployed in the case.

210.title: Woman poisons Class 8 boy as he secured more marks than her son
210.article_body: A woman allegedly killed the classmate of her son because he'd scored more marks than her son in the school examination in  Puducherry. The woman allegedly mixed poison pills in a soft drink and gave it to the school watchman, asking him to give it to the boy. The woman has been detained, while the Class 8 boy has died.

211.title: Several injured as Radha Soami followers, Nihang Sikhs clash in Punjab
211.article_body: A clash broke out between followers of the Radha Soami Satsang Beas (RSSB) and Nihang Sikhs in Punjab on Sunday evening, following which around six people sustained injuries, according to police. "No death has been reported so far," Amritsar SSP (Rural) Swapan Sharma said. He added that at least six rounds were fired in the air.

212.title: Yogendra Yadav resigns from Samyukta Kisan Morcha coordination committee
212.article_body: Social activist Yogendra Yadav on Sunday resigned from Samyukta Kisan Morcha (SKM) coordination committee. However, he said, he will be in touch with other movements as well, apart from the farmers' movement. "It is important that the energies of all movements and opposition political parties be joined to fight against the anti-farmer Modi government," he said.

213.title: Radhika Madan's 'Kacchey Limbu' to premiere at 47th Toronto Film Festival
213.article_body: Actress Radhika Madan's 'Kacchey Limbu' is all set to premiere at the 47th Toronto International Film Festival. She shared the teaser of the film on her Instagram handle with a caption that read, "#KaccheyLimbu gears for its World Premiere at the 47th Toronto Film Festival Gala presentation @tiff_net on 11th September 2022." The film is directed by Shubham Yogi.

214.title: Congress' 'Halla bol' rally is 'Rahul Gandhi relaunch 4.0': BJP
214.article_body: As Congress held a 'Mahangai Par Halla Bol' rally in Delhi, BJP spokesperson Rajyavardhan Singh Rathore said, "This rally is 'Rahul Gandhi relaunch 4.0' as no one wants to lead Congress." Rathore added that this rally is meant to save the family and not to protest against the price rise. The rally was addressed by Gandhi and other Congress leaders.

215.title: Mistry desired to keep contributing to India's economic progress: Nirmala
215.article_body: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said that the death of the former Chairman of the Tata Sons, Cyrus Mistry, comes as a "shock" to her. "He (Mistry) was committed to carrying forward and strengthening his business in infra and infra projects. He desired to keep contributing to India's economic progress. Condolences to his family and friends," Sitharaman said.

216.title: Smart selection: Manjrekar on Hooda's inclusion in India's squad vs Pakistan
216.article_body: Commenting on all-rounder Deepak Hooda's inclusion in India's playing XI against Pakistan in Super 4 stage match at Asia Cup 2022, Sanjay Manjrekar tweeted, "Smart selection by India." He added, "Hooda [is] in to keep depth in batting plus the option of the sixth bowler. No Dinesh Karthik, but Rishabh Pant stays for...left handed element." Hooda scored 16 (14) today.

217.title: Sushant Singh Rajput fan, who threatened to kill producer Sandeep Singh, arrested in Bihar
217.article_body: The police arrested a college dropout in Bihar for allegedly sending threat messages to film producer Sandeep Singh on social media earlier this year. The accused, identified as 21-year-old Krishna Kumar Singh, told police he is a fan of Sushant Singh Rajput and was "apparently angry" with Sandeep for what he had said in the media about the late actor.

218.title: Man who sued Nirvana over his naked baby pic on album cover, loses case
218.article_body: American rock band Nirvana has won the dismissal of a lawsuit filed by a man who claimed that the band using a picture of his naked four-month-old self was child pornography. Spencer Elden was featured swimming naked on the cover of a 1991 Nirvana album. Elden waited too long to allege that Nirvana sexually exploited him, the judge ruled.

219.title: Virat Kohli breaks world record for most 50+ scores in T20I cricket history
219.article_body: Former Team India captain Virat Kohli on Sunday broke the world record for registering most 50-plus scores in T20I cricket history, achieving the feat in the Asia Cup Super 4 stage match against Pakistan. Kohli's 60(44) against Pakistan is his 32nd 50-plus score in T20I cricket. He overtook compatriot Rohit Sharma, who has registered 50-plus scores 31 times.

220.title: You are loved, you are missed: Rakul on Rishi's birth anniversary
220.article_body: Rakul Preet Singh took to Instagram Stories on Sunday to share a post remembering late actor Rishi Kapoor on his birth anniversary. Sharing an old picture of Rishi, she wrote, "You are loved, You are missed, You are remembered, Always." Earlier today, Rishi's actress-wife Neetu Kapoor and his daughter Riddhima Kapoor Sahni also remembered him on his 70th birth anniversary.

221.title: Sorry for what's happened but not our problem: Juventus CEO on Ronaldo
221.article_body: Juventus CEO Maurizio Arrivabene said that they sympathise with Cristiano Ronaldo's struggles at Manchester United but it does not bother them. "We are sorry for what's happened to him in Manchester this year, but it's not our problem," he said. The Portuguese star has started just once in five league games this season and is yet to score a goal.

222.title: People with BJP are 'sadachari', those against are 'bhrashtachari': Bihar CM
222.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Sunday criticised the BJP and said that those that support the party are considered "sadachari" and those who speak against the party are "bhrashtachari". JD(U) charged the BJP-led central government with imposing an "undeclared emergency" in the country, "misusing" probe agencies to silence opposition voices and stoking "communal frenzy" in society.

223.title: Man arrested in Lucknow for marrying woman after lying he's Hindu
223.article_body: A gym operator has been arrested in Lucknow for marrying a woman after allegedly lying to her that he's Hindu. The couple reportedly married in a temple and the woman came to know that the man is Muslim when he forced her to convert. The man also allegedly threatened the woman with dire consequences if she told her family.

224.title: Williams sisters made me believe superheroes are real: Lewis Hamilton
224.article_body: Seven-time F1 world champion Lewis Hamilton said Serena Williams and Venus Williams made him believe that superheroes are real, and they can look like him. He thanked Serena for making him better in every way and said she will "always have a brother" in him. Lewis said he "never dreamed" he would call the sisters his friends.

225.title: Parineeti Chopra to help clean up Mumbai beaches post Ganpati Visarjan
225.article_body: Actress Parineeti Chopra has decided to clean up beaches in Mumbai after Ganesh Chaturthi celebrations. She said every year during Ganpati Visarjan, people "leave behind immense litter" on beaches which ends up in water. "This...can cause mass deaths of...marine animals," Parineeti added while urging people to join her to clean the Juhu beach post the Ganpati Visarjan on September 10.

226.title: I'd love to play for KKR if they build a women's IPL team: Richa Ghosh
226.article_body: On being asked which women's IPL team she aspires to play for, India Women wicketkeeper-batter Richa Ghosh said, "I would love to play for KKR if they build a women's IPL team." She added, "It would be great if they select most of their players from Bengal." The inaugural edition of women's IPL is scheduled to begin early next year.

227.title: Sonali's family writes to CJI for CBI probe, says 'Goa Police not supporting'
227.article_body: Haryana BJP leader and TikTok star Sonali Phogat's family has written a letter to the Chief Justice of India for a CBI probe into her death. "Goa Police is not supporting us...I think political influence is also behind this," her nephew Vikas Singh said. He added they are also waiting for the answer whatever comes from the Supreme Court.

228.title: Injured MP woman carried to hospital on cot for 6 km due to lack of road
228.article_body: Family members of a woman, who was injured due to electrocution, allegedly carried her on a cot for six kilometres to reach the nearest health centre in the absence of a road in a tribal area in Madhya Pradesh's Seoni. "I'll visit Bakharimal village...to take stock of the situation and to ensure easy transportation for the villagers," Ghansor SDM said.

229.title: I really like Rohit as a leader, batter: Waqar Younis
229.article_body: Former Pakistan skipper Waqar Younis said that he really likes Indian skipper Rohit Sharma "as a leader as well as a batter". "It's not that he (Rohit) is playing bad shots. Just that sometimes you aren't able to execute the right shots properly and that's why you end up getting dismissed," Younis said.

230.title: Indian economy will see double-digit growth this fiscal: Sitharaman
230.article_body: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Saturday said the Indian economy would see double-digit growth this fiscal. "We (India) have zero percent chance of slipping into recession. I hope for double-digit growth...We are literally the fastest growing economy," the Finance Minister said. Notably, India is currently the fifth largest economy in the world.

231.title: Road crashes claimed 1.55 lakh lives in India in 2021, about 18 lives per hour: Data
231.article_body: Over 1.55 lakh lives were lost in road crashes across India in 2021, marking an average of 426 daily or 18 every single hour. According to government data, this is the highest death figure recorded in any year so far. Besides the deaths, 3.71 lakh people were injured in 4.03 lakh 'road accidents' in India last year, NCRB data revealed.

232.title: Remains of woman believed to be a 'vampire' found in Poland, pics show sickle across neck
232.article_body: The 17th-century remains of a woman who was believed to be a vampire were found by archaeologists in Poland. The skeletal remains were found with a sickle placed across her neck to prevent her from 'rising from the dead', said an archaeologist. A padlock was also seen around the toe of the female who was given an 'anti-vampire' burial.

233.title: Ravi Shastri makes blunder during toss for India-Pakistan match, video goes viral
233.article_body: A video has gone viral on social media showing Ravi Shastri making a blunder during the toss for India-Pakistan Super 4 stage match in Asia Cup 2022. After India captain Rohit Sharma spun the coin, Babar Azam called 'tails', however Ravi Shastri said in the mic, "Heads is the call," after which the match referee looked confused.

234.title: 17 years ago, I played you and now, I'm interviewing you: Blake to Nadal
234.article_body: Following Rafael Nadal's third round win at US Open 2022, ex-tennis player James Blake tweeted, "17 years ago, I played you on Arthur Ashe Stadium and now I'm interviewing you because you're still one of, if not the, greatest in the world." In the third round at US Open 2005, wildcard Blake beat second seed Nadal 6-4, 4-6, 6-3, 6-1.

235.title: Means a lot to help youngsters: Bumrah on his time at NCA
235.article_body: Indian pacer Jasprit Bumrah commented on his ongoing rehab stint at the National Cricket Academy (NCA) in Bengaluru. "Not long ago, I was on the other side, learning, observing and grasping everything I could," Bumrah said. He added, "Which is why it means a lot...to be able to use the knowledge I have today to help youngsters along the way."

236.title: Bed Bath & Beyond CFO jumps from 18th floor days after announcing job cuts, dies
236.article_body: Gustavo Arnal, the CFO of Bed Bath & Beyond, died after he jumped from the 18th floor of a skyscraper in New York City on Friday, police confirmed. The incident occurred days after the US-based retailer announced plans to lay off 20% of its staff and close several stores. Last month, the 52-year-old executive sold company shares worth $1 million.

237.title: 28-yr-old Karni Sena leader Rohit Rajput stabbed to death in MP, murder caught on camera
237.article_body: A 28-year-old Karni Sena leader named Rohit Singh Rajput was stabbed to death in front of a municipality office in Itarsi area of MP's Narmadapuram district on Friday night. Rajput and his friend were standing in the main market area when three men on motorcycles approached them, leading to a fight. A video the crime has surfaced on social media.

238.title: 2 Odisha forest dept officials suspended after elephant electrocuted
238.article_body: Two officials of the Odisha State Forest Department were suspended on Sunday over dereliction of duty a day after a 10-year-old female elephant was found electrocuted in a village. "Had they been alert, the elephant wouldn't have died of electrocution from the hanging live wire that was set up for [a] wild boar," Dhenkanal DFO Prakash Chand Gogineni said.

239.title: We each stick to our own opinions: Pallavi on political differences with Vivek
239.article_body: Actress Pallavi Joshi spoke about how she deals with political differences with her filmmaker-husband Vivek Agnihotri. "Sometimes we come on the same page. Sometimes we don't. And we each stick to our own opinions," she said. "We're fine with it. We're two individuals and every morning, when we...sit in...living room, we've...tea together, but we don't drink from...same cup," Pallavi added.

240.title: India record their highest-ever score in powerplay in a T20I against Pakistan
240.article_body: India scored 62/1 in the first six overs against Pakistan on Sunday, their highest-ever score in a powerplay in a T20I against Pakistan. Rohit Sharma and KL Rahul slammed a combined 4 fours and 4 sixes in the powerplay. India's previous highest score in a powerplay in a T20I match against Pakistan was 48/1, scored in Ahmedabad in 2012.

241.title: I'm yet to find someone who praised the film: Prakash on 'Laal...'
241.article_body: Filmmaker Prakash Jha has said that it's not the boycott trend that has affected the box office performance of Aamir Khan's 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. He added that a majority of those who have seen it aren't praising it. "I am yet to find someone who has said, 'Wow, what a film it was'," Prakash further said.

242.title: Kvitova saves 2 match points, beats Muguruza to reach last 16 at US Open
242.article_body: Czech Petra Kvitova saved two match points before making a third set comeback to defeat ninth seed Garbine Muguruza and reach the last 16 at US Open 2022 on Saturday. The 21st seed trailed 2-5 before levelling the third set 5-5 and forced a super-tiebreak to win the match 5-7, 6-3, 7-6(12-10) in two hours 38 minutes.

243.title: Hope more talent joins the profession: President on Teacher's Day eve
243.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu on Sunday extended her greetings on the eve of Teacher's Day. She said she hopes that more talent joins the profession. "Our teachers are continuously trying to improve their capabilities and proficiency through new research, experiments and innovations," an official statement from Rashtrapati Bhavan said quoting President Murmu.

244.title: Courts expected to play role of Oppn in certain cases: Ex-CJI Ramana
244.article_body: Former CJI NV Ramana said courts should be dispassionate and in certain situations, they are expected to play the role of or supplant the Opposition. He added that the courts have played an important role in ensuring that constitutional rights are not a dead letter. Ramana said the 1960s and 1970s were the most challenging periods in modern Indian history.

245.title: Pak captain Babar trolled for 'Play confidentially' message to his team for India match
245.article_body: Pakistan captain Babar Azam was asked during the toss by Ravi Shastri about what his message to his team is for match against India. Babar responded, "Play confidentially." Babar was trolled for his response, with a fan tweeting, "Not sure if it's cricket or what." Another wrote, "I hope they play confidentially." "What a start to the match," tweeted another.

246.title: Goa Police visits residence of Sonali Phogat's personal assistant for investigation
246.article_body: The Goa Police, as part of their investigation into BJP leader Sonali Phogat's death, visited her personal assistant Sudhir Sangwan's house in Rohtak, Haryana. The team, after making enquiries at the residence, then reportedly left for Gurugram. It is the fifth day of Goa Police's investigation in Haryana with the team reaching Hisar on Wednesday to visit Phogat's farmhouse.

247.title: If there are fielding restrictions, then no one is as dangerous as Pant: Waqar
247.article_body: Former Pakistan pacer, Waqar Younis said that having wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant on the bench is a "luxury for India". "All of us...were shocked at how he (Pant) is not playing [in India-Pak match]. I personally feel he is best suited in the top-order," Waqar said. He added, "If there are fielding restrictions, there is no one as dangerous as him."

248.title: Does BJP's SOP include barging into ATC Control Rooms?: TMC MP
248.article_body: TMC MP Mahua Moitra asked on Twitter if the "BJP's SOP for bringing down Opposition...now [includes] barging into ATC Control Rooms?" Moitra was referring to BJP MPs Nishikant Dubey and Manoj Tiwari being booked for reportedly pressuring authorities at Jharkhand's Deoghar airport to clear their chartered jet for a nighttime takeoff. Moitra said she knew "BJP's SOP...involves chartered planes".

249.title: Among the best business minds of his generation, called away too soon: Adani on Mistry
249.article_body: Adani Group Chairman Gautam Adani on Sunday said he was shocked and saddened to hear about the death of 54-year-old former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry. "One of the finest gentlemen I've known, he was one of the best business minds of his generation," said Adani on Mistry. "It's a tragic loss. He was called away too soon," Adani added.

250.title: Cyrus Mistry's death shocking, loss for entire business world: Maha CM
250.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Sunday condoled the death of former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry, saying it was not just a loss for his family but for the entire business world. Mistry was not just a successful industrialist, but a young and visionary entrepreneur as the business world looked up to him with hope, CM Shinde added.

251.title: Emraan Hashmi to star in Karan Johar’s OTT series: Reports
251.article_body: Emraan Hashmi will reportedly star in Karan Johar's upcoming production venture, which will be helmed by Mihir Desai and Archit Kumar. The suspense-drama series is slated to go on floors this year and will stream on an OTT platform. The series will also reportedly feature an ensemble of actors. The makers are yet to share details on the project.

252.title: GST officers can initiate proceedings in cases of over ₹5 cr evasion
252.article_body: The Finance Ministry has clarified that GST officials can initiate legal proceedings against offenders in cases where the amount of evasion is more than ₹5 crore. It added that the ₹5 crore limit would not apply in the case of a company/taxpayer habitually involved in tax evasion, misusing Input Tax Credit (ITC) facility or fraudulently obtained refund.

253.title: Maha Deputy CM Fadnavis orders probe into accident that claimed Cyrus Mistry’s life
253.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis on Sunday said he has asked police to conduct a detailed investigation into the accident that claimed the life of former Tata Sons chairman Cyrus Mistry. A senior Mumbai police official had said the car in which Mistry was travelling had rammed into a divider on a bridge on the Surya river.

254.title: Kartik Aaryan signs director Anurag Basu's upcoming romantic film: Reports
254.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan has reportedly signed director Anurag Basu's upcoming romantic film. A source told Bollywood Hungama that the film is one of a kind of love story that hasn't been seen in Hindi cinema before. "Anurag Basu's film will give Kartik a chance to extend his performing skills beyond anything he has done so far," the source added.

255.title: 63 pistols seized, 3 arms suppliers arrested by Punjab Police in MP
255.article_body: Punjab Police has arrested three illegal arms suppliers and seized 63 country-made pistols from the latter's possession in Madhya Pradesh's Khargone, an officer said. According to him, 24 cases were earlier registered against the three accused, who used to supply pistols in Punjab and Rajasthan, among other states. Two other persons were arrested last month with four pistols, he added.

256.title: Cyrus was amongst brightest business minds in the country: Rahul
256.article_body: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi condoled the death of former chairperson of the Tata Group, Cyrus Mistry, who passed away in a road accident near Mumbai on Sunday. "Saddened by the tragic news...He (Mistry) was amongst the brightest business minds in the country, who made a significant contribution to India's growth story. My heartfelt condolences to his family," Rahul tweeted.

257.title: Thunderous rainfall across Karnataka till September 9: IMD
257.article_body: The IMD has predicted thunderous rainfall across Karnataka, especially Bengaluru, three coastal districts and hilly areas till September 9. Heavy rains are expected for Monday in Bengaluru while a yellow alert has been issued for Kodagu, Shivamogga, Udupi and other districts. Thousands of houses across the state capital have been inundated as CM Basavaraj Bommai visits flood-affected localities.

258.title: Paytm denies links to Chinese loan merchants being probed by ED after raids
258.article_body: Paytm parent entity One97 Communications on Sunday denied having links with the loan merchants that are under investigation by ED in the Chinese loan app case. It said the merchants were "independent entities", a day after ED raided Paytm's Bengaluru office and announced the freezing of some funds. Paytm said the funds frozen by ED don't belong to it.

259.title: Compensate family of those who died of COVID vaccine after-effects: HC
259.article_body: The Kerala High Court has asked the National Disaster Management Authority (NDMA) to frame a policy for identifying and compensating the dependents of those who died due to the after-effects of the COVID-19 vaccine. "Even if the numbers are very few, there are instances where people are suspected to have succumbed to the after-effects of immunisation," the court said.

260.title: India announce their playing XI for Asia Cup Super 4 match against Pakistan
260.article_body: Pakistan captain Babar Azam won the toss and elected to bowl first in their Asia Cup 2022 Super 4 stage match against India. India all-rounder Hardik Pandya, who was rested against Hong Kong, has been included in the playing XI. Deepak Hooda and Ravi Bishnoi have also been included in the playing XI.

261.title: SRK didn't answer, jokes Hasan Minhaj as he poses in front of Mannat
261.article_body: American comedian-actor Hasan Minhaj took to Instagram to share a picture of himself posing outside the gate of Shah Rukh Khan's Mumbai bungalow Mannat. "Pulled up to Shah Rukh's. He didn't answer tho," he jokingly wrote. Reacting to his post, a fan wrote, "Of course you did Hasan. Of course you did. It's part of...India tour...It has to be done."

262.title: Woman sets self on fire in MP, alleges police inaction on rape complaint
262.article_body: A 26-year-old woman sustained severe burns, as she set herself on fire after the police allegedly failed to register a case based on her complaint of rape in MP's Shahdol, an official said on Sunday. The woman is undergoing treatment in a hospital, while Amlai police station in-charge Mohammed Sameer and sub-inspector Savitri Singh have been relieved of their duties.

263.title: Ex-Kerala Minister Shailaja declines to accept Magsaysay Award
263.article_body: Former Kerala Health Minister KK Shailaja has said that she was considered for the Ramon Magsaysay Award for 2022, but she declined to accept it after holding talks with her party, CPI(M). She said, "Magsaysay (former Philippines President) had been anti-communist. I was considered for the award as an individual." She said she has communicated her decision to them.

264.title: Rahul Gandhi says 'Atta cost ₹22/litre in 2014, it now costs ₹40/litre', video goes viral
264.article_body: During the 'Halla Bol' rally, Congress' Rahul Gandhi, while comparing prices of daily use items, said, "Atta (flour) used to cost ₹22 per litre in 2014, it now costs ₹40 per litre." Gandhi, who immediately corrected himself, was trolled online. Reacting to trolling, Congress shared a video of his speech and wrote, "Leave 'litre', take care of the public."

265.title: Versova police take Kamaal R Khan's custody for allegedly molesting actress in 2019
265.article_body: Actor Kamaal R Khan, who was in judicial custody over a controversial tweet posted by him in 2020, has now been taken into custody by Versova police for allegedly molesting an actress in 2019. The actress, in her police complaint, had said that Khan molested her at his house after promising her the lead role in a Hindi movie.

266.title: Haryana man hires UP gang to rob daughter's house, 4 arrested
266.article_body: A man named Sandeep Singh in Haryana hired a gang of three robbers from Uttar Pradesh to carry out a theft in his married daughter's house, police said. Police said the robbers decamped with ₹4 lakh cash and jewellery by taking her mother-in-law hostage at gunpoint. The accused Sandeep Singh, Pankaj Kumar, Kapil and Sompal were arrested by the police.

267.title: I'm told his real name is Aslam, why hide it: Kangana on Mahesh Bhatt
267.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut took to her Instagram Stories on Sunday to share an old video of filmmaker Mahesh Bhatt and wrote, "I am told his real name is Aslam." "He converted to marry his second wife...it is a beautiful name, why hide it?" she added. Kangana made her debut with 'Gangster', which was backed by Mahesh Bhatt.

268.title: NGO involved in Karnataka seer case seeks police protection
268.article_body: Mysuru NGO Odanadi Seva Samsthe, which had filed a complaint against Lingayat Chitradurga math's head seer, has asked the police for protection. The NGO founders said math supporters called them several times and they fear for their lives. Two girls of the math had approached the NGO and alleged that head seer Shivamurthy Murugha Sharanaru sexually assaulted them for years.

269.title: Credit to Manmohan, Narasimha govts for India overtaking UK's GDP: Basu
269.article_body: Ex-Chief Economist of the World Bank, Kaushik Basu commented after India surpassed the UK to become the world's fifth-largest economy. "If anyone gets credit for India overtaking UK's GDP, it's Narasimha Rao & Manmohan Singh's governments," Basu tweeted. He added, "India's growth spurt from 1994 & even faster growth from 2005 made this inevitable, despite the sharp slowdown since 2016."

270.title: CBI raids homes of TMC MLA Subodh Adhikari, brother in chit fund scam
270.article_body: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) on Sunday raided the residences of TMC MLA Subodh Adhikari and his brother Kamal Adhikari in connection with the chit fund scam, in which people were cheated of lakhs of rupees, officials said. Kamal Adhikari is also the chairman of the Kanchrapara Municipality. The CBI raided seven locations in West Bengal on Sunday.

271.title: 50-yr-old man sexually assaults stepdaughter for 5 yrs in Pune, held
271.article_body: The Pune Police on Saturday arrested a 50-year-old man for sexually harassing his 19-year-old stepdaughter for the past five years, officials said. According to the complaint filed by the girl, the accused used abusive language and clicked naked pictures of her, said SB Kadam, police sub-inspector at Sangvi police station, adding that he also followed her to college.

272.title: Launching soon: Peyush on video of cart made by Shark Tank's Jugadu Kamlesh
272.article_body: Lenskart Co-founder and Shark Tank India's judge Peyush Bansal took to Instagram to share a video of a cart for agricultural purposes made by the show's contestant Jugadu Kamlesh. "Launching soon...Bharat K2 - Motorised, Adjustable, Easy to Use, Affordable," Bansal captioned the video. During the show, Bansal offered Kamlesh ₹10 lakh for 40% equity and a ₹20 lakh loan.

273.title: Really tragic Cyrus passed away at such a young age: Tata Sons' Chandrasekaran
273.article_body: Tata Sons Chairman N Chandrasekaran condoled the death of former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry, who passed away at the age of 54 in a car accident near Mumbai. "He had a passion for life and it's really tragic that he passed away at such a young age," N Chandrasekaran said. "I'm deeply saddened by his untimely demise," he added.

274.title: Who was driving the car that met with an accident in Maharashtra, killing Cyrus Mistry?
274.article_body: Former Tata Sons chairman Cyrus Mistry was killed after his car hit a divider in Maharashtra. There were four people in the car and Anahita Pandole, a top doctor at Breach Candy Hospital, was driving the vehicle, police said. Anahita and Darius Pandole, the CEO of JM Financial Private Equity, were injured, while another person named Jahangir Pandole was killed.

275.title: Don't miss this contest within contest: Kaif ahead of India-Pak Asia Cup game
275.article_body: Mohammad Kaif took to Twitter ahead of India-Pakistan Super 4 stage match at Asia Cup and wrote, "There are many reasons to watch today's game. For me it's India's top three vs raw Pakistan pace." He added, "Rohit Sharma, KL Rahul, [and] Virat Kohli can tackle speed but with young Pakistan speedsters you never know. Don't miss this contest within...contest."

276.title: KL's role is to anchor innings; just needs couple of more boundaries: Kaif
276.article_body: Former India cricketer Mohammad Kaif said that batter KL Rahul's role is to "anchor" the innings. "Rahul is an outstanding player and doesn't need to change a lot of things...He just needs to score a couple of more boundaries in the powerplay," Kaif said. He added, "Rohit [Sharma] is looking to score quickly so that Rahul can play his game."

277.title: I try to stay in my zone, play the game: Suryakumar ahead of India-Pak game
277.article_body: Talking about his preparations ahead of the Super 4 stage match against Pakistan at Asia Cup 2022, India batter Suryakumar Yadav said, "I just try to stay in my zone...play the game." He added that there have been a lot of talks regarding the India-Pakistan match, with people saying it's the greatest rivalry, but it's like playing just another match.

278.title: 2-year-old girl dies of snakebite in Thane after delay in treatment
278.article_body: A two-year-old girl bitten by a snake died after she allegedly could not get timely treatment in Maharashtra's Thane district. The incident took place on Saturday, following which the girl was taken to the Temba health centre, reports said. The centre is not equipped to handle emergency cases and the girl needed special care, a medical officer said.

279.title: Trump says Zuckerberg came to White House for dinner with him 'last week'; trolled
279.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump was trolled after he claimed Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg came to the White House for dinner last week. "The weirdo...kissed my a** all night...'Sir, you're number one on Facebook. I'd like to congratulate you'," Trump said on Saturday. Twitter users pointed out that Trump left White House in 2021 and that he's suspended from Facebook.

280.title: Give money or else: Video of Kerala boy assaulting family for cash goes viral
280.article_body: A video of a Kerala teen assaulting his family members and demanding money has gone viral on the internet. In the video, which was shot by an onlooker, the boy can be seen yelling and thrashing the windows of his house. The boy can also be seen kicking an old woman and throwing slippers at another.

281.title: I only met Cyrus Mistry once, he was all dignity and class: Harsha Bhogle
281.article_body: Cricket commentator Harsha Bhogle on Sunday condoled the death of former Tata Sons chairman Cyrus Mistry and tweeted, "I only met Cyrus Mistry once. He was all dignity and class." He added, "Can't believe he is gone." Mistry, 54, passed away on Sunday in a road accident near Mumbai after his car hit a divider.

282.title: Shocked & saddened: Vedanta's Anil Agarwal on  Cyrus Mistry's demise
282.article_body: Vedanta's Chairman Anil Agarwal on Sunday condoled the demise of former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry. Taking to Twitter, Agarwal said, "Corporate India has lost a promising son. Shocked and saddened to hear of the untimely demise of Cyrus Mistry. Deepest condolences to his family." Mistry passed away aged 54 in a road accident near Mumbai on Sunday.

283.title: Cong is oblivious; has no vision, policy & no leadership: BJP
283.article_body: The BJP on Sunday mocked the Congress rally against the price rise, saying that the party is oblivious to ground realities, adding that the party has no vision, no policy and no leadership. Congress has lost 90% of elections since 2014, said BJP national spokesperson Rajyavardhan Singh Rathore. Congress' rally is an attempt at relaunching Rahul Gandhi, he added.

284.title: Ashok Chavan denies joining BJP, calls reports 'baseless'
284.article_body: Senior Congress leader Ashok Chavan on Saturday denied rumours of him joining BJP and called them baseless. “I am in Delhi now and will be attending the Bharat Jodo rally in Ramlila Maidan. All the speculations about me joining the BJP are baseless. I just happened to be at Ashish Kulkarni’s place when he (Fadnavis) arrived,” Chavan said.

285.title: PM Modi condoles Cyrus Mistry's death, says 'big loss to world of commerce & industry'
285.article_body: PM Narendra Modi expressed his condolences after the demise of former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry. He wrote, "The untimely demise of Shri Cyrus Mistry is shocking. He was a promising business leader who believed in India's economic prowess. His passing away is a big loss to the world of commerce and industry...May his soul rest in peace."

286.title: Aditya's 'Come...' gets standing ovation at US theatre; Vishal shares video
286.article_body: Filmmaker Aditya Chopra's Broadway musical 'Come Fall In Love', based on his 1995 film 'Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge', received a standing ovation from the audience at The Old Globe theatre in San Diego, US. Musical duo Vishal-Sheykhar, composers of 'Come Fall In Love', shared a video on their respective Instagram handles. "Feeling proud as an Indian," Sheykhar wrote.

287.title: Jammu-Srinagar National Highway reopens for light vehicles
287.article_body: The Jammu-Srinagar National Highway reopened for light vehicles going towards Kashmir on Sunday. The highway was blocked at Udhampur due to shooting stones and landslides in the Ramban area after heavy rainfall. Several roadways were waterlogged and commuters were stuck in various parts of Jammu and Kashmir due to rains.

288.title: Vice President urges media to make people aware of organ donation
288.article_body: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar urged religious leaders and media to create awareness about organ donation. “Media and social media have a great role in this mission. Every media person must contribute to spreading this well-meaning message,” Dhankhar said. He also called organ donation a sensitive issue and emphasised the need for creating a support system for donation.

289.title: Cyrus Mistry, who died in a road accident today, lost his father Pallonji Mistry 2 months ago
289.article_body: Former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry, who passed away in a road accident on Sunday, lost his father and construction tycoon, Pallonji Mistry, two months ago. Cyrus passed away aged 54 in a road accident on Sunday near Mumbai after his car hit a divider. Shapoorji Pallonji Group's head, Pallonji Mistry, passed away in late June aged 93 in Mumbai.

290.title: Hard to digest this news: Mahindra after Cyrus Mistry killed in road accident
290.article_body: Businessman Anand Mahindra condoled the demise of former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry. He tweeted, "Hard to digest this news. I got to know Cyrus...during his...tenure as the head of the House of Tata. I was convinced he was destined for greatness. If life had other plans for him, so be it, but life itself shouldn't have been snatched...from him."

291.title: Had brotherly love for Irrfan, we used to play for 3 hrs like children: Deepak
291.article_body: Actor Deepak Dobriyal said in an interview that he had "brotherly love" for late actor Irrfan Khan, with whom he worked in 'Hindi Medium' and 'Angrezi Medium'. "We would spend a lot of time together; his hotel room was next to mine," he added. Deepak further said they used to play for three hours "like children" in the evening.

292.title: RJD leader Vijendra Yadav killed in Bihar's Rohtas district
292.article_body: RJD leader Vijendra Yadav was shot dead on Saturday near Nimdihara Road in Rohtas district in Bihar. According to reports, he was going for farming work when six bike-riding criminals opened fire at him. "One bullet hit the head and one hit the neck due to which he died on the spot," said the police.

293.title: Deeply anguished by sudden passing away of Cyrus Mistry: Piyush Goyal
293.article_body: Union Minister of Commerce and Industry Piyush Goyal on Sunday condoled the demise of former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry. Taking to Twitter, Goyal said, "Deeply anguished [and] shocked by the sudden passing away of Cyrus Mistry." "Indian industry has lost one of its shining stars whose contributions to India's economic progress will always be remembered," he tweeted.

294.title: 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' has given the industry hope: Kiara Advani
294.article_body: Kiara Advani said 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2', which was one of the highest-grossing film of 2022, gave "the industry hope". She said the film's success was "overwhelming" and everyone was "happy with the result". "It was incredible to be a part of a family comedy that also has an element of horror and was part of a well-known franchise," she said.

295.title: Would love to get to 20 years in my career: Ed Sheeran
295.article_body: Singer Ed Sheeran said he wants to complete two decades of his career and announce retirement like Coldplay, which he called "an achievable milestone". He said the milestone "is quite scary" as there is still a long way to go for him, but "U2 and Coldplay are two acts" he looks at "avidly". Coldplay hinted at retirement in 2021.

296.title: Congress leaders go to jail in buses & leave within an hour: Azad
296.article_body: Former Union Minister Ghulam Nabi Azad criticised the Congress and said that party leaders go to jail in buses and leave within an hour. “People from Congress now go to jail in buses, they call DGP, Commissioners get their name written and leave within an hour. That is the reason Congress has been unable to grow,” said Azad.

297.title: Was apprehensive, but my wife convinced me: Dheeraj on 'Jhalak...'
297.article_body: TV actor Dheeraj Dhoopar said he was apprehensive about participating in 'Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa 10', but his wife Vinny Arora Dhoopar convinced him. He said that while the show is out of his comfort zone, it is also the "best way to start" his reality show career. He hoped to emerge as a "better performer" after the show.

298.title: Pics show Cyrus Mistry's damaged car after he was killed in road accident near Mumbai
298.article_body: Several pictures showing the damaged car after former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry was killed in a road accident while travelling from Ahmedabad to Mumbai have surfaced online. According to authorities, his Mercedes hit a divider on a bridge on the Surya river in Maharashtra's Palghar area. There were four people inside the car and two, including Mistry, passed away.

299.title: Will definitely happen: Kamal Haasan on 'Vettaiyaadu Vilaiyaadu' sequel
299.article_body: Actor Kamal Haasan, who was present at the trailer launch of 'Vendhu Thanindhathu Kaadu', said the sequel of 'Vettaiyaadu Vilaiyaadu' will "definitely happen". He said director Gautham Menon "had discussed the gist" of the sequel a couple of years ago, but COVID-19 pandemic "played spoilsport". "We will finalise the project at the earliest," Kamal said.

300.title: Saw myself in him: Rajamouli on ‘Brahmastra’ director Ayan Mukerji
300.article_body: SS Rajamouli said when Ayan Mukerji narrated 'Brahmastra' to him, all his childhood fantasies came alive. He also admired Ayan for the time and energy he invested in creating the film's universe. Talking about 'Brahmastra' and Ayan's dedication, Rajamouli said the filmmaker reminded him of himself when he chose to skip the film's promotional event to complete work on it.

301.title: I-T Department nod not necessary for NDTV acquisition: Adani Group
301.article_body: The Adani Group has said that there's no need to get approval from income-tax authorities for its deal to acquire NDTV. "The IT orders have been issued against RRPR only and for the purpose of securing RRPR's continued ownership over the said NDTV shares," it said, citing a reply received from VCPL. RRPR Holding is the promoter group behind NDTV.

302.title: Activists protest against Maha govt over Metro shed construction in Aarey
302.article_body: Activists in Mumbai staged a protest on Sunday against the state government and the Metro car shed being constructed in Aarey Colony. The protestors said Aarey is a forest comprising wildlife and tribals, hence it should not be cut down. The CM Eknath Shinde-led Cabinet had reversed the previous government's decision and given a green light to the project.

303.title: Uddhav responsible for Ganesh Chaturthi celebration without curbs: Sena
303.article_body: The Shiv Sena on Sunday claimed the credit for the restriction-free celebration of the ongoing Ganesh Chaturthi festival goes to party chief Uddhav Thackeray. Thackeray fought the COVID-19 pandemic for two years with strict restrictions (when he had served as the CM of Maharashtra) and created awareness about the safety protocols, an article in the Sena mouthpiece 'Saamana' said.

304.title: Don't want to put my nose there: Sheikh Hasina on India-China ties
304.article_body: During an interview with ANI, Bangladeshi Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina said "If there is a problem, it is between China and India, I don't want to put my nose there". When asked about Dhaka's relationship with two nations, she said that her main goal is development. "Our foreign policy is clear - friendship to all, malice to none," she added.

305.title: Hamas executes 2 Palestinians for spying, 3 for murder in Gaza
305.article_body: Hamas authorities in Gaza executed five Palestinians on Sunday. Two convicted spies, aged 44 and 54, have been executed on charges of espionage for Israel in 2009 and 2015, according to Hamas-run Interior Ministry. Three others have been convicted of murder. The latest executions, carried out by hanging or firing squad, are the first in the territory since 2017.

306.title: 2 arrested from Gujarat for 15-year-old Mumbai girl's murder
306.article_body: Two men, Santosh Makwana and Vishal Anbhavne, both 21 years of age, have been arrested for the murder of a 15-year-old girl from Mumbai. The two were arrested from Gujarat. Police said Santosh had been in a relationship with the deceased girl. According to reports, the girl's mother had thrashed Santosh after knowing they spent days together away from home.

307.title: My brother Cyrus Mistry passed away, can't believe it: Supriya Sule
307.article_body: NCP MP Supriya Sule condoled the demise of former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry and tweeted, "Devastating news my brother Cyrus Mistry passed away. Can't believe it." "Rest in Peace Cyrus," she added. Mistry passed away aged 54 in a road accident near Mumbai on Sunday after his car hit a divider.

308.title: Pak don't have a player like Hardik, that's India's biggest advantage: Javed
308.article_body: Ahead of India-Pakistan Super 4 stage match at Asia Cup 2022, ex-Pakistan cricketer Aaqib Javed said the "biggest advantage" that India have is Hardik Pandya. "Pakistan doesn't have an all-rounder like that, he's as effective as Abdul Razzaq was for us," he added. Hardik scored 33* and posted 3/25 in India's five-wicket win against Pakistan in group stage last week.

309.title: Pune to procure 0.1 million vaccines for lumpy skin disease: Officials
309.article_body: In an emergency procurement, the Pune Zilla Parishad is procuring 0.1 million doses of vaccines to check and prevent the spread of lumpy skin disease, officials said. Ring vaccination would reportedly be carried out as a preventive measure to ensure that cases of lumpy skin disease are controlled. Notably, two deaths have been recorded due to the disease across Pune.

310.title: Actor Manit loses two flats in Noida's twin towers demolition, says 'It was painful'
310.article_body: 'Kundali Bhagya' serial actor Manit Joura in an interview with ETimes said that he lost two flats in Noida's Supertech twin towers demolition that took place on August 28. "It was painful. I didn’t even see the video of the demolition," said Joura. The actor said that his family initially didn't know there was a case against the structure's developers.

311.title: Diwali deadline for India-UK FTA not going to be missed: Commerce Secy
311.article_body: Commerce Secretary BVR Subrahmanyam told PTI that the proposed free trade agreement (FTA) between India and the UK is in the final stages of negotiations. "There are a couple of areas where we are negotiating...Diwali deadline is not going to be missed," he said. India could see a $10-$15 billion uptake in exports from the FTA, the Secretary further said.

312.title: It's easy to join & leave Congress but difficult to remain in it: Adhir
312.article_body: Congress leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury on Sunday said that it is easy to join and leave the Congress but it is difficult to remain in the party. "Friends come and go in life but life is also like a river," Chowdhury added without naming anyone. He was speaking at Congress’ 'Mehangai par halla bol' rally held in Delhi today.

313.title: Govt mulls over PLI scheme for furniture to boost exports: Report
313.article_body: The government is mulling over a Production Linked Incentive (PLI) scheme for certain types of furniture in a proposal that is at the discussion stage, a PTI report said. The aim is to boost domestic manufacturing, exports and create jobs. The government has already rolled out PLI scheme with ₹2 lakh crore outlay for 14 sectors, including textiles, automobiles, etc.

314.title: He was a friend, a man of substance: Harsh Goenka on Cyrus Mistry's death
314.article_body: RPG Enterprises Chairman Harsh Goenka took to Twitter to condole the demise of former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry. Goenka tweeted, "He was a friend, a gentleman, a man of substance. He was instrumental in creating...Shapoorji Pallonji and ably led the Tata group." Mistry died in a road accident while en route from Ahmedabad to Mumbai.

315.title: Gujarat Titans will definitely retain Gurbaz for IPL 2023: Jaffer
315.article_body: Praising Rahmanullah Gurbaz, Wasim Jaffer said that the 20-year-old Afghanistan opener is an exciting player. "I am sure Gujarat Titans will retain him for the next edition of the IPL," he added. Gurbaz was signed by Gujarat Titans in the IPL 2022, but he did not get a chance to make it to the playing XI.

316.title: Railways to run Onam special trains between Hyderabad-Trivandrum
316.article_body: The South Central Railway (SCR) announced that Onam special trains will be operated between Hyderabad and Trivandrum to reduce the passenger rush during the festival season. The Hyderabad-Trivandrum special train (Train No. 07119) will depart from Hyderabad at 6.15 pm on September 5 and the returning train will depart from Trivandrum at 10 pm on September 10.

317.title: Notorious bandit Sarla Jatav released from UP jail after 17 years
317.article_body: Notorious bandit Sarla Jatav walked out of Uttar Pradesh's Etawah jail after 17 years after Allahabad High Court granted her release. Named in several cases, including murder, kidnapping and extortion, Jatav was convicted and sentenced to life imprisonment. She was only 11 when she was kidnapped by a dacoit named Nirbhay Gujjar.

318.title: Cyrus Mistry, former Tata Sons chairman, passes away aged 54 in road accident near Mumbai
318.article_body: Former Tata Sons chairman Cyrus Mistry passed away aged 54 in a road accident while en route from Ahmedabad to Mumbai. The accident took place on a bridge on the Surya river after the car hit a divider, authorities said. Two other persons injured in the accident have been hospitalised.

319.title: No eggs, chicken in meals for juvenile homes: Madhya Pradesh minister
319.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Home Minister Narottam Mishra said the state will not implement the gazette notification that prescribed serving eggs and chicken in juvenile shelter homes. The notification was issued by the state's Women and Child Development Department on August 25. "This will not be allowed in Madhya Pradesh. There is confusion on this issue," Mishra said.

320.title: Unfinished 9,000-passenger cruise ship may be scrapped due to lack of a buyer
320.article_body: An unfinished cruise ship worth £1.2 billion with a 9,000-passenger capacity may be scrapped before its first voyage. The company that built the Global Dream II, filed for bankruptcy in January and hasn't found a buyer as yet. Its sister liner, the first Global Dream ship, is also up for sale but may not be axed.

321.title: Hatred rising in India, BJP & RSS are dividing country: Rahul Gandhi
321.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, while speaking at the 'Mehangai par halla bol' rally in Delhi, on Sunday said that BJP and RSS are "dividing the country" and creating fear. "Hatred is rising in India. Fear of inflation and unemployment is increasing in India…Only two industrialists in the country are benefitting from this fear and hatred," Gandhi added.

322.title: PM Modi, I'm not scared of your ED: Rahul Gandhi
322.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, while speaking at the Ramlila Maidan during the party's 'Halla Bol' rally on Sunday, said that anger and hatred have increased since the BJP came to power. Further, targeting PM Narendra Modi, he said, "Anyone who raises a voice against Modi is attacked." "I want to tell PM, I'm not scared of your ED," he added.

323.title: Delhi govt schools scores below national average in various subjects: NCPCR
323.article_body: The National Commission for Protection of Child Rights has alleged in its report that the scores recorded by the Delhi government schools in three subjects (maths, science and social science) are below the national average. The NCPCR report claims that government schools in Rajasthan, Gujarat and Madhya Pradesh have fared better than Delhi state-run schools.

324.title: Overflowing Ganga, Yamuna water recede from Prayagraj areas, dirt left behind
324.article_body: Overflowing waters from Ganga and Yamuna rivers have receded from low-lying areas in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj, reports said. However, according to reports, dirt and garbage have been left behind after water has receded. News agency ANI had earlier shared a video of water entering residential areas in parts of the city.

325.title: Opposition will be trapped in the traps they have laid for us: Soren
325.article_body: As legislators of the ruling coalition in Jharkhand are returning to Ranchi from Raipur for vote of trust in Jharkhand Assembly tomorrow, Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren said that Opposition will be trapped in the net they have laid for the ruling camp. Soren will move a motion of confidence in extended monsoon Assembly session to prove his majority on Monday.

326.title: Riddhima pens note on late father Rishi Kapoor's birth anniversary
326.article_body: Rishi Kapoor's daughter Riddhima Kapoor Sahni took to Instagram Stories and penned a note for the late actor on his 70th birth anniversary. "We miss you so much, especially today, but 'with a cheer, not a tear in our eye'. Love you, Papa," she wrote. Riddhima also shared a picture of the late actor.

327.title: 1 dead, 4 hospitalised after toxic gas leak at chemical unit in Maha
327.article_body: A worker died and four others were hospitalised after a toxic gas leak in a chemical unit in Maharashtra's Palghar district on Sunday morning, an official said. Following the gas leakage, the workers present in the unit complained of giddiness and other complications, he said. The incident took place around 7 am.

328.title: Banke Bihari temple to have airport-like queue system after stampede
328.article_body: Days after two people were killed in a stampede in Mathura's Banke Bihari Temple, temple authorities have decided to adopt a new crowd control system. Reports said airport-like queues and barricades will be part of the new system. "People [will] have to follow the barricades and walk in the queue. Barricades will begin from outside the temple," an official said.

329.title: Critically injured python rescued in Mumbai to undergo plastic surgery
329.article_body: A 10-feet-long python fighting for its life because of multiple fractures and wounds will undergo plastic surgery, which could be a breakthrough in treating the critically injured endangered wildlife, officials said. The Indian rock python was rescued by the Resqink Association for Wildlife Welfare (RAWW) and the Forest Department in August, reports said.

330.title: 16-year-old budding athlete killed in Faridabad: 3 arrested
330.article_body: A 16-year-old budding athlete, Priyanshu, was allegedly stabbed to death by multiple men after the former was returning from a sports complex in Sector 12, Faridabad. The police have arrested three men namely Ajay (19), Abhishek (19) and Deepak (25). Notably, Ajay also trains at the same sports complex and had planned to murder Priyanshu over some enmity, police said.

331.title: Pimpri Chinchwad Police keeps close watch on 1,700 Ganesh mandals
331.article_body: The Pimpri Chinchwad Police has asked its personnel to visit Ganesh mandals and keep a close watch in respective station jurisdictions throughout the day. Pimpri-Chinchwad has over 1,000 Ganesh mandals. "One police personnel has to make at least three visits to a Ganesh mandal a day. They have to interact with the volunteers," Pimpri-Chinchwad Police Commissioner Ankush Shinde said.

332.title: Wanted to make it sound funny: Tejasswi on her accent in 'Naagin 6'
332.article_body: Actress Tejasswi Prakash addressed the criticism over her accent in her TV serial 'Naagin 6' and said, "I wasn't following any accent, it wasn't legitimate." Tejasswi revealed that she wanted to make her accent sound "extremely funny". "If people found it funny, that's great. Whatever sells...My show is working even when not everything happening in it makes sense," she added.

333.title: Sex racket operating in guise of spa busted in Pune; 4 arrested
333.article_body: Pune rural police have busted a sex racket that was being operated in the guise of a spa centre in Nanded City on Friday. Acting on a tip-off, police sent a decoy customer to "Blue Berry Spa" in Nanded City destination centre and later they carried out a raid there. Subsequently, four people, including the spa owner, have been arrested.

334.title: Will be disappointed if Kashmir Files doesn't get National Award: Pallavi
334.article_body: Actress Pallavi Joshi, who produced 'The Kashmir Files' in addition to acting in it, said in an interview that the film deserves a National Award. "If we don't get that one National Award, I guess I will be disappointed," she added. Pallavi further said she is aware that the film won't be nominated at any other award ceremony.

335.title: Tribal teen dies in police custody in MP, 5 policemen suspended
335.article_body: A 19-year-old tribal man, arrested in a loot case, died in police custody in Madhya Pradesh's Dr Ambedkar Nagar, police said on Sunday. Claiming that he died due to police excesses, the victim's relatives staged a protest at the police station and temporarily blocked the Agra-Mumbai National Highway. Five policemen were suspended following the protest.

336.title: Silence from B'wood fraternity is deafening: Pak actress Mehwish on floods
336.article_body: Pakistani actress Mehwish Hayat has expressed disappointment towards Bollywood celebrities for their silence on the floods in Pakistan. Taking to Instagram, she wrote the "silence from...Bollywood fraternity is deafening", adding, "'Suffering knows no nationality...or religion' - no better time for them to show us they can rise above nationalist politics and care about their fans in Pakistan."

337.title: Hyd Police busts cricket betting racket, seize ₹1.8 lakh; 4 arrested
337.article_body: The South Zone Commissioner's Task Force, along with Chatrinaka Police, arrested four persons who were operating a cricket betting racket and seized ₹1.8 lakh. The main accused got addicted to cricket betting during the COVID-19 lockdown and befriended the main bookie, identified as Ali from Maharashtra. Ali organised cricket betting by providing applications.

338.title: PM Modi-led govt has 2 brothers, unemployment & inflation: Jairam
338.article_body: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh on Sunday said that unemployment and inflation are "two brothers" of the PM Narendra Modi-led government. "We want to send an effective message to the insensitive [PM] Modi government that people are suffering from this back-breaking inflation and unemployment and solutions should be found for them," Ramesh said before Congress’ rally commenced today in Delhi.

339.title: Delhi govt to construct elevated road, flyover, underpass to reduce traffic
339.article_body: In a move to reduce traffic congestion in the national capital, Delhi government will soon construct an elevated road, a flyover and an underpass, according to an official statement. The elevated road will be built on GT Road between Azadpur and Rani Jhansi Road intersection, the statement said. A flyover will be built between Nand Nagri and Gagan Cinema.

340.title: Not psychopath, has criminal mindset: MP police on 'Serial killer Stoneman'
340.article_body: The Madhya Pradesh Police, while talking about the 'serial killer stoneman' who had murdered four guards, said that he is not a psychopath. "He has a criminal mindset. He is behaving like an ordinary person. He is well-versed in social media and knows a bit of English as well. He killed the four to make quick money," an official said.

341.title: 9 migrants die while trying to cross Rio Grande river into US
341.article_body: At least nine migrants died while trying to cross the rain-swollen Rio Grande river near Eagle Pass in US' Texas. Officials from both US and Mexico borders have launched search operations following the incident. Moreover, US Customs and Border Protection said that 53 migrants, including 37 who were rescued from the river, were taken into custody on Thursday.

342.title: Video of Salman Khan putting glass inside his jeans' pocket goes viral
342.article_body: A video of actor Salman Khan putting a glass inside his jeans' pocket went viral. In the video, he can be seen coming out of his car and putting the glass inside the pocket as security personnel protected him from getting mobbed. "What is inside the glass?" a user commented. "He always carries glass of his drink...with him," wrote another.

343.title: Betting on Indian economy to surpass Germany, Japan's within this decade: Paytm CEO
343.article_body: Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma tweeted, "I'm betting on us, crossing Germany and Japan within this decade." India surpassed the UK to become the fifth-largest economy, behind the US, China, Japan and Germany, according to Bloomberg. "The timing is so perfect", Sharma added as he shared an article that said India achieved the feat in its 75th year of freedom.

344.title: At least 8 Russian businessmen died in mysterious circumstances since Jan
344.article_body: At least eight prominent Russian businessmen have died in mysterious circumstances or by apparent suicide since late January. While four businessmen were linked to Gazprom or its subsidiaries, two others were associated with Lukoil, Russia's second-largest oil producer. Lukoil's Chairman Ravil Maganov died recently after he reportedly fell from a hospital window.

345.title: Binance identifies 2 suspects involved in $265,000 KyberSwap hack
345.article_body: Cryptocurrency exchange Binance's security team has identified two suspects who may have been involved in stealing $265,000 on decentralised cryptocurrency exchange aggregator KyberSwap, according to Cointelegraph. On September 1, Kyber Network faced frontend vulnerability which enabled the attacker to steal $265,000 in user cash. Binance said it is working with law enforcement agencies.

346.title: MS Dhoni to lead CSK in IPL 2023, confirms CSK CEO Kasi Viswanathan
346.article_body: CSK CEO Kasi Viswanathan has confirmed MS Dhoni will lead the franchise in IPL 2023. "There's no change in our stance. We never said...there will be a change," he told InsideSport. Earlier, Dhoni had said that he would "definitely" play in IPL 2023. "It will be unfair to not play in Chennai and say 'Thank you'," he had said.

347.title: 'Degree holder shoe polish, pakoda stall' put up outside Cong's rally venue in Delhi
347.article_body: Protesting against price hike at 'Mehangai par halla bol' rally at Delhi’s Ramlila Maidan, youth Congress workers on Monday organised a 'degree holder shoe polish, pakoda stall' outside the venue. "Through this symbolic protest, we want to convey the message to our PM who once said ‘fry the pakodas’ on issue of employment," a member of Rajasthan Youth Congress said.

348.title: Muslim man's cab attacked in Hyd, forced to say 'Jai Shree Ram'
348.article_body: A Muslim cab driver's car was attacked in Hyderabad and a group of unidentified men allegedly forced him to say 'Jai Shree Ram', reports said. The victim alleged he was on his way to pick up a customer when a few people started hitting his car windows. "I drove straight past them, but there was a roadblock," the victim said.

349.title: Govt school teachers meet Sisodia, seek assault on them as non-bailable offence
349.article_body: The Government Schools Teachers' Association (GSTA) met Delhi Deputy Chief Minister and Education Minister Manish Sisodia on Saturday. They presented him with a memo seeking legislation making any criminal act or assault on teachers and staff on school premises a non-bailable offence. They also demanded schools with student strength of over 2,500 be run in two shifts for better stability.

350.title: Soldier kills wife, daughter inside Assam Rifles camp in Srikona
350.article_body: A soldier was arrested after he allegedly killed his wife and minor daughter inside a camp of the Assam Rifles in Srikona on Saturday over a family feud, officials said. Following the incident, the soldier escaped and hid inside a temple in the camp. The bodies of the deceased were seen lying in a pool of blood, an official said.

351.title: Delhi govt opens liquor shops at several metro stations, list released
