351.article_body: Delhi government's Excise Department on Saturday started selling liquor at shops located at Delhi Metro station premises in several areas. These stations include Dwarka, Karol Bagh, Rajouri Garden and Mundka, a senior Excise department officer told PTI. "Metro stations have...high footfall and that is a big factor in ensuring access to liquor products and thereby more revenue," the officer said.

352.title: Former Punjab CM Parkash Singh Badal hospitalised due to fever
352.article_body: Former Punjab CM and Shiromani Akali Dal's Parkash Singh Badal has been admitted to a hospital due to a mild fever. Badal's medical examination is underway at the hospital, party leader Daljit Singh Cheema said. The 94-year-old was admitted to a private hospital in Mohali in June after he had complained of gastritis and bronchial asthma.

353.title: Musk says Chris Rock invited him to do stand-up comedy at his show; people react
353.article_body: World's richest man Elon Musk tweeted that comedian Chris Rock has invited him to open one of his shows. Several Twitter users encouraged him with tweets like, "You'll do well, Elon...You're pretty hilarious," and "I always thought you were a stand-up guy, Elon!" A user also tweeted "no slapping", referring to Chris being slapped by Will Smith at the Oscars.

354.title: Rublev beat Shapovalov in 4 hours 8 minutes to enter US Open 4th round
354.article_body: Ninth seed Andrey Rublev defeated 19th seed Denis Shapovalov 6-4, 2-6, 6-7(3-7), 6-4, 7-6(10-7) to enter the fourth round at US Open 2022 on Saturday. The 24-year-old Russian won the third round match in four hours eight minutes. Rublev will play against seventh seed Cameron Norrie in fourth round. Norrie beat Holger Rune 7-5, 6-4, 6-1 in third round.

355.title: SRK's 'Baazigar', 'Darr' inspired me to become an actor: Kartik Aaryan
355.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan, talking about what inspired him to become an actor, said, "'Baazigar' and, in fact, 'Darr' too inspired me to become an actor." Speaking of Shah Rukh Khan-starrer Baazigar, Kartik said, he watched the film in his childhood. The 31-year-old made his Bollywood debut in the 2011 film 'Pyaar Ka Punchnama'. Kartik recently featured in 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'.

356.title: Congress was made by us, by our blood, not by computers or Twitter: Azad
356.article_body: Ghulam Nabi Azad, who recently resigned from Congress, said, "Congress was made by us by our blood, not by computers or Twitter." "People are trying to defame us but their reach is limited to computers and tweets. That is the reason Congress is nowhere to be seen on the ground," Azad said during a public meeting in Jammu today.

357.title: 3 arrested for mobile theft worth ₹12.25 lakh at Ganesh festival in Pune
357.article_body: Three members of a mobile theft gang who used to target people during the Ganesh festival have been arrested in Pune. A total of 84 mobile phones worth ₹12.25 lakh were seized from the accused. They all are from Karnataka and had come to Pune especially for the 10-day festival. The accused are aged between 19 and 24.

358.title: It all happened impromptu: Balki on Big B turning music composer for Chup
358.article_body: Speaking about actor Amitabh Bachchan becoming a music composer for his film 'Chup', R Balki said, "It all happened very impromptu." Balki added he asked Amitabh to watch 'Chup'. After watching the film, Amitabh played a tune on his piano. "He was very touched...I asked him if I could use the tune...he immediately gifted it to the movie," Balki stated.

359.title: Afghan national arrested with 4 kg heroin worth ₹20 crore in Delhi
359.article_body: Gujarat Anti-Terror Squad (ATS) arrested an Afghan national with four kilograms of heroin, estimated to be worth ₹20 crore, from Delhi. According to Gujarat Police, the accused, who has been identified as Wadiullah Rahimulla, was arrested from the Vasant Kunj area in the national capital. He was arrested after the police received information about the same from Surat Crime Branch.

360.title: One of the world's most twisted buildings unveiled in China; pics surface
360.article_body: One of the world's most twisted skyscrapers named 'Dance of Light' was recently unveiled in China's Chongqing. Built by architectural firm Aedas, the 180-metre-tall building uses double-curved surfaces on the facades to create an impression that the structure is twisted. According to Aedas, the building has a 'twisting angle' of up to 8.8 degrees per floor.

361.title: Delhi cab driver masturbates in front of 23-year-old UK lawyer, she leaves India
361.article_body: A cab driver was arrested for allegedly masturbating in front of a 23-year-old woman from the UK while ferrying her to a hotel in South Delhi, police said. The incident happened on Friday when the complainant, a London-based lawyer, and her friend booked a cab on an app from Delhi airport. The complainant left the country after the incident.

362.title: Class 11 TN girl delivers & throws baby in bushes; Class 10 boy held for impregnating her
362.article_body: A 16-year-old Class 11 girl allegedly delivered a baby and abandoned him in the bushes near her school in Tamil Nadu's Cuddalore district. The dead body of the baby was found by another student, following which police was informed. The girl told the police that her boyfriend, a Class 10 student in a private school, was responsible for her pregnancy.

363.title: Charges framed against Sanjay Singh in UP over 2008 protest
363.article_body: A local court in UP framed charges against 14 people including AAP MP Sanjay Singh and former SP MLA Anoop Sanda in connection with a street protest against the power department in 2008. The demonstration had reportedly led to a traffic jam with the agitators blocking the road. Earlier in 2008, a case was registered against 36 people.

364.title: NASA's Artemis l mission faces weeks of delay after launch scrubbed
364.article_body: NASA's Artemis l mission's launch could be delayed by at least several weeks after two scrubbed launch attempts. The officials said they will likely have to roll the SLS rocket back to its assembly building to make repairs. NASA Administrator Bill Nelson said if the rollback happens, a new attempt to launch the mission may not happen until mid-October.

365.title: Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant loses external power again: IAEA
365.article_body: The Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant lost external power again, according to the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA). A reserve line continued to supply electricity to the grid. Only one of the six reactors remained operational, the IAEA added. Europe's largest nuclear power plant has been witnessing shelling with Russians and Ukrainians blaming each other.

366.title: Maha tribal woman gives birth in bedsheet on way to hospital, loses baby
366.article_body: A 32-year-old tribal woman in labour was carried to a hospital in a bedsheet due to lack of roads in Maharashtra's Bhiwandi. The woman gave birth on the way but the baby passed away before reaching the health centre which is 1.5 km away from the village. As per villagers, health department staff visited her next day for post-delivery treatment.

367.title: I roped in a Kashmiri tutor for diction: Aparshakti on 'Dhokha...'
367.article_body: Actor Aparshakti Khurana, who will play a Kashmiri terrorist in the film 'Dhokha: Round D Corner', said that getting the character's diction right was important for him. "Kashmiris have a different accent that is unique to them...I roped in a Kashmiri tutor to keep it more authentic," he added. The film also features R Madhavan and Darshan Kumaar.

368.title: Moosewala's parents still getting threats, Punjab govt a failure: Congress
368.article_body: Leader of Opposition (LoP) in Punjab Vidhan Sabha Partap Singh Bajwa criticised Bhagwant Mann-led AAP government and said that the Punjab government is "failure" in managing law and order in state. The Congress leader said that Sidhu Moosewala's father is still receiving threats from gangsters and it appears that the tall claims of the Punjab government were completely hollow.

369.title: India should show more generosity: Hasina on water-sharing dispute
369.article_body: Bangladesh PM Sheikh Hasina while commenting on the India-Bangladesh water-sharing dispute told ANI, "We're downstream, water is coming from India. So, India should show more generosity." Calling it a "long-standing problem", she said that the dispute should be resolved. "We found that [PM Narendra Modi] is very eager to solve this but the problem is in your country," she added.

370.title: UP man gives wife triple talaq for gaining weight after marriage
370.article_body: A 28-year-old woman in Uttar Pradesh's Meerut has alleged that her husband gave her triple talaq as she gained weight after marriage. In a police complaint, Nazma Begum claimed that her husband taunted and tortured her, and kicked her out of the house. The couple, married for about eight years, has a seven-year-old son.

371.title: Scammer pretends to be Nikhil Chinapa, asks for money from others
371.article_body: DJ Nikhil Chinapa on Sunday took to Twitter to share screenshots of a WhatsApp chat of a scammer who was pretending to be him and asking for money from others. "People I follow on Instagram and who also have a business account are getting messages for money, from a scammer pretending to be me," Chinapa tweeted.

372.title: J&K people will decide name of my party, flag; will be a Hindustani name: Azad
372.article_body: Former Congress leader Ghulam Nabi Azad, who resigned from the party recently, held a public meeting in Jammu on Sunday. Azad said he will launch a new party soon, adding, "I've not decided upon a name for my party yet. The people of J&K will decide the name and the flag for the party. I'll give a Hindustani name."

373.title: Gulf countries financing 'love jihad' in India: Gujarat BJP MLA
373.article_body: Gujarat BJP MLA Shashikant Pandya in a press conference said that the Gulf countries are financing 'love jihad' in India. The MLA said that those countries provide funds to Muslim clerics in India for the purpose. Notably, various groups held protests in Deesa on Saturday over the conversion of three members of a Hindu family.

374.title: Ali Anwar seeks opposition support for welfare of Pasmanda Muslims
374.article_body: Former Rajya Sabha MP Ali Anwar and chief of All India Pasmanda Muslim Mahaz wrote a letter to the opposition parties, seeking support for the welfare and development of Pasmanda Muslims and other backward communities. “Pasmanda is not just a vote bank, but it is a part of the fight for social justice and equality,” said Anwar.

375.title: It's awkward, think I'm gonna die: BTS' RM on sending message to fans from airport
375.article_body: K-pop boy and BTS' leader RM was spotted at Seoul's Gimpo Airport on his way to Tokyo on Saturday when a member of the media asked him to send a message to fans. RM said, "It's so awkward I think I'm gonna die...It's my 10th year since my debut and it's really awkward. I'll go and come back safely."

376.title: Not every person jailed is criminal by nature, sometimes it's circumstances: Shah
376.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Sunday said the view with which jails are seen in society needs to be changed. Speaking at the inauguration of the 6th All India Prison Duty Meet in Ahmedabad, Shah added, "Not every person jailed is criminal by nature, sometimes it's circumstances which force their involvement."

377.title: 4 Afghan kids playing with unexploded shell killed after it detonates
377.article_body: Four children were killed after an unexploded shell detonated when they started playing with it in their school in Afghanistan's Helmand, police and a doctor said. The children had discovered the ordnance and brought it inside the school, as per a statement by the provincial police chief's office. Three other children were also injured in the incident, the statement added.

378.title: Thousands evacuated as wildfire burns 4,000 acres of land in US
378.article_body: Thousands of residents were evacuated after a rapidly spreading wildfire burnt about 4,000 acres of land in US' California. According to authorities and officials, about 100 houses were destroyed and two people were injured in the wildfire. Moreover, California Governor Gavin Newsom has proclaimed a state of emergency for Siskiyou County. The wildfire had started on Friday.

379.title: China's top legislator to visit Russia for Eastern Economic Forum
379.article_body: China's top legislator Li Zhanshu is all set to attend the seventh Eastern Economic Forum in the Russian city of Vladivostok, official Xinhua news agency reported. Li, chairman of the National People's Congress Standing Committee, will be the most senior Chinese official to visit Russia since the country invaded Ukraine. He will also visit Mongolia, South Korea and Nepal.

380.title: Govt shouldn't run businesses as firms run by them aren't efficient: Maruti Chairman
380.article_body: Maruti Suzuki India Chairman RC Bhargava said the government shouldn't be running businesses as companies run by them "aren't efficient". He added, "[The companies] don't have productivity. They don't generate profit…They need government support all the time to grow." He added, "For most capital investments they need...funds from the government. You can't have industrial growth from taxation".

381.title: Neetu shares pic with Rishi Kapoor on late actor's birth anniversary
381.article_body: Actress Neetu Kapoor shared a picture with her late husband and actor Rishi Kapoor on his 70th birth anniversary on Sunday. Along with the picture, the 'JugJugg Jeeyo' actress wrote, "Happy birthday." Several celebrities, including Kareena Kapoor Khan and Karan Kundrra, reacted to the post. Kareena commented, "Happy birthday, Chintu uncle."

382.title: Be the Union Home Minister: Chidambaram on Narottam's remark
382.article_body: Congress leader P Chidambaram criticised MP Home Minister Narottam Mishra over “sleeper cells” remark and asked him to be the Union Home Minister if he has more information than Amit Shah. “The MHA once said that the government had no information on the tukde-tukde gang… If Mishra has the information then he should become the Union Home Minister,” said Chidambaram.

383.title: 'We lost ₹225 crore in a day to floods,' say Bengaluru-based IT and banking firms
383.article_body: Bengaluru-based major IT and banking companies collectively lost ₹225 crore due to the flooding of Outer Ring Road on August 30 as their staff were stuck for more than 5 hours, the organisation representing the companies said. The organisation has urged Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai to address infrastructure issues in the city, saying, "Inadequate infrastructure...has now reached a crisis level."

384.title: Look who's grown up and a mother now: Arjun pens note for Sonam
384.article_body: Actor Arjun Kapoor on Saturday took to social media to share a picture with his cousin actress Sonam Kapoor. The actor wrote alongside the picture, "Look Who's all grown up & is a mother now !!! OMG it's you @sonamkapoor." Sonam welcomed her baby boy on August 20 with her husband fashion entrepreneur Anand Ahuja.

385.title: Halla Bol rally marks the season 5 of 'Rahul Relaunch': BJP
385.article_body: The BJP criticised Congress’ Halla Bol rally and called it an event to relaunch MP Rahul Gandhi. BJP Spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla tweeted that the Halla Bol rally is the fifth attempt of the Party to relaunch Rahul Gandhi. “NASA has contacted Congress to ask it how they managed to relaunch a failed rocket again & again,” said Poonawalla.

386.title: Cannabis plant without flowering or fruiting tops can't be considered 'ganja': Bombay HC
386.article_body: The Bombay High Court while granting pre-arrest bail to a man accused of possessing commercial quantity of narcotic substance ruled that a seized cannabis plant without flowering or fruiting tops does not fall under the purview of 'ganja'. The court was hearing the pre-arrest bail plea filed by Kunal Kadu, who was apprehended arrest by the NCB under NDPS Act.

387.title: Kohli should see till T20 WC 2022 whether T20 cricket suits him: Akhtar
387.article_body: Ex-Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar said he would suggest Virat Kohli to evaluate till T20 World Cup 2022 whether T20 cricket "suits" him. "Kohli's both innings [in Asia Cup so far] were quite patchy," added Akhtar. "When he plays...the longer formats, Kohli will get time to settle," he stated. "I...want him to score...100 centuries and break Sachin Tendulkar's record," said Akhtar.

388.title: China reports 1,848 COVID cases, Shenzhen under weekend lockdown
388.article_body: Mainland China recorded 1,848 new COVID-19 cases on September 3 with 384 symptomatic cases, according to the National Health Commission. The country recorded 1,988 new cases a day earlier, with 502 symptomatic cases. Most residents in the southern technology hub of Shenzhen went into a weekend lockdown on Saturday as authorities began mass COVID-19 testing.

389.title: Changing name of AIIMS would lead to loss of identity: Faculty body
389.article_body: Changing the name of AIIMS would result in a loss of identity of the institution, said Faculty Association of All India Institute of Medical Sciences (FAIMS). In a letter to its members, the association expressed concern over speculations that AIIMS could be named after some famous personality, leader or a freedom fighter. "Identity is linked with the name," it said.

390.title: I don't expect Rishabh Pant to play against Pakistan: Wasim Jaffer
390.article_body: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer said he doesn't expect Rishabh Pant to be picked for the upcoming match against Pakistan, considering the presence of Dinesh Karthik. Pant wasn't selected for the previous game against the same opposition as well. Discussing the upcoming match against Pakistan, Jaffer stated, "We haven't played the brand of cricket we discuss, that aggressive approach [against them]."

391.title: Hasina thanks PM Modi for evacuating Bangladeshi students amid Ukraine war
391.article_body: Bangladesh PM Sheikh Hasina thanked PM Narendra Modi for evacuating students of her country amid the war between Ukraine and Russia. "Many of our students were just stuck and they came to Poland [for] shelter. But when you [evacuated Indian] students...they also brought our students back home," she said. She also thanked PM Modi for contributing COVID-19 vaccines to Bangladesh.

392.title: Psychologist sexually harasses female students in Hyderabad, jailed
392.article_body: A Hyderabad-based psychologist was sentenced to 16 days of imprisonment for harassing and making sexual advances towards female students online. The accused conducted counselling sessions in institutions and gave his number under the pretext of sending motivational quotes. However, when students contacted him, he'd harass them and share graphic images in an attempt to coerce them into a sex chat.

393.title: Cong workers gather for Halla bol rally, Delhi police say no one detained
393.article_body: A huge crowd of supporters of the Indian National Congress, on Sunday, gathered at the Ramlila Maidan in Delhi for the 'Mehangai par halla bol' rally. The Delhi Congress took to Twitter to share a video of the crowd. Meanwhile, Hemant Tiwari, Additional DCP of Delhi Police denied the reports of Congress workers being detained.

394.title: 3 booked for posing as Lawrence Bishnoi gang, extorting money from farmer
394.article_body: A man and his two sons have been booked for allegedly posing as Lawrence Bishnoi's gang members and extorting ₹50 lakh from a farmer in Haryana. The victim told police the accused were aware he recently received ₹75 lakh as compensation for giving his land for a railway line project. He said accused threatened to murder him like Sidhu Moosewala.

395.title: The Weeknd ends concert abruptly mid-song after 'losing voice'; releases statement
395.article_body: The Weeknd's concert at Los Angeles' SoFi Stadium was cancelled abruptly on Saturday. "I don't know what just happened...I just lost my voice [mid-song], this is killing me...but I can't give you the concert," he told the crowd. He apologised in a statement and said, "I felt it (voice) go and my heart dropped. My deepest apologies to my fans."

396.title: Firoz Nadiadwala in talks with Anand Pandit for Hera Pheri 3: Report
396.article_body: Film producer Firoz Nadiadwala is in talks with producer Anand Pandit to revive the third instalment of the 2000 film 'Hera Pheri'. "The two have been discussing all the possible...combinations to bring...Raju, Shyam and Baburao back together, however, the things are not there on paper yet," a source revealed. The 2000 film featured Akshay Kumar, Paresh Rawal and Suniel Shetty.

397.title: 26-yr-old MP woman sets self on fire after police refuse to file rape case
397.article_body: A 26-year-old woman set herself on fire at a police station in Madhya Pradesh on Friday, officials said. She had gone to the police station to lodge rape case against a revenue officer. The woman alleged that police did not accept her complaint and advised her to "settle matter outside". The revenue officer was also present at the police station.

398.title: Illness behind 54% of suicides reported in Ludhiana in 2021: NCRB report
398.article_body: National Crime Records Bureau (NCRB) released a report stating illness is the main reason behind suicide by at least 192 people, including 146 men and 46 women, in 2021 in Ludhiana. This accounts for 54% of total suicides reported in the year. In 2021, 307 people, including 71 women, committed suicide in Ludhiana which is 13.5% less compared to 2020.

399.title: 'Did I rape her?' says Karnataka BJP MLA on being questioned over threatening a woman
399.article_body: When a reporter asked Karnataka BJP MLA Aravind Limbavali why he threatened a woman activist in public, Limbavali said, "You are speaking in favour of women. Speak in favour of the people...What have I done? Have I raped her?" A video showed Limbavali shouting at and threatening the woman, who was protesting against the demolition of her property in Bengaluru.

400.title: Who am I to save anyone?: Chhattisgarh CM on housing Jharkhand MLAs in Raipur
400.article_body: Reacting to question of housing Jharkhand MLAs in Raipur to save Hemant Soren-led Jharkhand government, Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel on Sunday said, "Who am I to save anyone (state govt)?" "They are guests in my state," he added. Earlier on Friday Baghel said that his state will soon witness Enforcement Directorate (ED) and Income Tax (I-T) department raids.

401.title: Two transgender men allegedly harassed, thrashed in Gurugram
401.article_body: Two transgender men who are board members of an NGO were allegedly harassed and beaten up by a man dressed as a policeman in Gurugram. As per their complaint, the man was the father of another transgender man who had taken up voluntary residence at their shelter home in July. The accused allegedly took them to a police station.

402.title: I went through 'tough moments': Nadal on win in US Open 3rd round
402.article_body: Four-time champion Rafael Nadal has now entered the fourth round of US Open, following a 6-0, 6-1, 7-5 win against Frenchman Richard Gasquet. Nadal remains unbeaten against Gasquet having won his 18th match against the latter. "[The] third set (was) a challenge. He increased the level...I went through...difficult moments," said Nadal. "I need to keep going," he added.

403.title: India will be second largest economy in world by 2047: Commerce Secy
403.article_body: Commerce Secretary BVR Subrahmanyam said on Saturday that India will be among the top four economies globally within a few years and the second largest economy in the world by 2047. "There was a time when India had a share of 25% of the world economy. The way India is growing, we will regain the same position," he said.
